1.description: The food, juices, and shakes are EXCELLENT. One of the workers attitude is EXTREMELY HORRIBLE for no reason no matter how pleasant you are. I know it's gonna be a wait on the food because it's cooked when ordered. I get that, I'm 100% patient, but I don't need her negative energy preparing what has to go in my mouth either. I spend way too much money for that type of rudeness. I hope she's replaced soon, then, I'll go back. Until then, I'll just venture around. She needs to work at a place like ED Debevic's. Her rude attitude fits their atmosphere perfectly.

0.description: This place has the best jerk salads. They are made to order the way you like. Because of that they are very slow so call ahead. But the food and smoothies are great. If your not in a rush or on a short lunch break this place is a must try.

3.description: J and J's Fish is a pretty good fast fried food stand. It offers fish and shrimp, along with wings and other such goodies. J and J's is still going strong despite the closing of several of the local restaurants along Stony near 87th Street. It delivers a decent product with good portions.J and J's is good. It makes and serves good fish, shrimp and wings. It is one of a dwindling number of alternative places to find food near 87th and Stony Island.

1.description: I've been coming here since forever and now they moved to a lot across from their old spot and it's all high tech! The new spot has large l.e.d. screens that showed the menu so nice and clear like. No more handwritten signs with the fluctuating price of catfish. The service is great as usual, with the creepy man staring at me the whole time I'm there (I only come to this place once a year and the same man creepily stares at me every time). The fish is always fried just right, never overcooked, with just enough fries and bread...and my favorite, cole slaw. Mmmmmm, so happy to have a taste of this every time I come back to Chicago, but happy I can't eat this fried food all the time!

2.description: Stopped by today to pick up some wings. The store only had one customer waiting. I thought I would be in and out. Unfortunately I was there longer than expected. When the lady who came in after me got her food first, I was  a little irritated. When I inquired about my order the guy behind the counter  was less than friendly. I was not happy about his reaction. My first thought was never again. When i got home I was shocked. The chicken wings were fantastic. They were  seasoned perfectly and cooked just right. I can overlook the wait and the attitude for great food!!!

5.description: All I can say is Harolds better watch out.

0.description: I ordered the catfish dinner with French fries. The fish was fried golden brown and was very crisp and fresh. The wait time was short and the restaurant was clean. I will definitely be returning in the future.

4.description: Seriously, they have THE BEST chicken wings in the city! I will put them up against Harold's any day of the week! The wings are reasonably priced and the service is super quick. Call ahead and if they tell you it will be ready in 10  minutes - it's ready in 10 minutes.

1.description: I set an appointment with them on Friday through Styleseat. I received a reminder message and was all set and excited to go. I arrived at 11:02 to find the shop dark and locked up. I called the shop 3 times I'm hopes that it would forward to a cell phone. After waiting for 20 minutes I left and found a shop a block away. As I am waiting to get my hair done at the new shop, Oury calls me and ask if I can return. No I cannot but thanks. This shop is a terrible waste of time and I will not be returning.

0.description: I bring my daughter here to get her hair braided once a month. They are very fast and the braids are very neat. The shop is very clean and the owner is very professional. There's a lot of hair braiding places in this area but I will always come here. I highly recommend them for any type of hair braiding.

3.description: Such a great experience! I'm going on a cruise and recently had a bad spray tan done. She fixed me up really well and made the perfect tan for my very pale skin. She also talked about the spray being more naturals then others, and that it has an SPF of 15 which is always good to have! Nice price too!

1.description: This was my first time getting a spray tan ever and im beyond pale but needed color for my friends California wedding!  Ive only heard of bad things from tanning salons and I couldn't take a risk. I found Melissa and she worked me in perfectly with her and my schedule.  She was super quick and made the whole process very comfortable and professional.  My tan on this porcelain skin looks Ah-mazing! !! I will definitely be using her again. Can't wait to post pics once the tan fully sets!

2.description: VERY disappointed!!! Never showed up, I would have gone somewhere else. I was going out of town for a wedding. Never have had her out before, but saw the reviews online.l Figured I could have her come out before I left town, and was able to make the appointment about a week prior. Thought if I got the spray done close to when I was leaving it could set, and still last long enough on my trip. We texted back, and forth, came up with date, and time. she was supposed to come out at 8pm.  I worked that day, and rushed home showered got all ready for her and, no call, didn't answer texts, or voice mails. I consider that VERY UNPROFESSIONAL!! I just didn't want anyone else to to go through what I did. Most events that you want to look tan at are important ones. Don't take a chance on someone who won't show up, or even have the courtesy to call. Good luck on your search.

5.description: The Glow Fairy gives you a stunning tan without the orange! She's on call and makes time to come and spray you! It's fast, easy, and an excellent deal!! You won't be disappointed after your spray! Skip the orange and the burnt skin in the beds! Thank you Melissa for keeping us fabulous!

6.description: Melissa is the best glow fairy around!! She makes you feel totally comfortable and gives you a great color(any shade), with no streaks, and all from the comfort of your own home.  She is wonderful and I highly recommend her :)

0.description: What can I say that hasn't already been said? Melissa's the best. She immediately put me at ease, and made my first experience SO easy. She gave me great after-care tips, and even put up with me when I had a post-tan freakout (I'm very very pale, so being tan was very foreign to me). The end result- despite my moment of panic- was gorgeous. Fair warning- you may look a little darker immediately afterwards, but there's an instant bronzer in the spray that's the culprit. Once you shower, the tan is totally natural and soft.I've recommended Melissa to everybody I know. She was affordable, fun, and produced great results.

4.description: As someone who is paler then pale and stays out of the sun, I was a bit scared to get a spray tan.  Melissa did a fabulous job on me and made me feel completely comfortable!  The tan didn't look unnatural or fake at all, just the perfect glow for a summer vacay!  Best part is the reasonable price and that she comes to you!  I would highly recommend the glow fairy to any friend or family member.

3.description: I was recommended by Leak funeral home to use this florist. They gave me the number. I spoke with a nice woman and ordered a hundred dollar arrangement. To my surprise the flowers never came to the wake or the funeral. The woman claimed they were delivered. No money back. No flowers to the right room at the funeral home. Disappointed.

1.description: I ordered flowers for same day delivery through fromyouflowers.com and the order was filled by Flowers Unlimited. I was very satisfied with them. The arrangement was fresh, the delivery was on time, and the arrangement was a good value for the price. They lose a star just because a few stems could have been better placed in the vase to get the arrangement to the next level. Otherwise, it was all good.

2.description: I had been doing a brisk business with this company for over 20 years. Each and every occasion I would plunk down my money for overpriced flowers for just about every occasion. In all fairness, many of the arrangements were beautiful and the delivery most of the time was when requested (I can think of only one instance out of many orders when delivery was not made).  I can not think of many times when I did not spend under $200.00 several times a year on different occasions. At any rate, I'd been telling all my friends and family to take their business there . . . that is until now.My daughter asked me to place a Mother's Day order for sunflowers as a special tribute to her mother, my wife, from her and her two siblings. My immediate thought was to place the order through Flowers Unlimited. She suggested that I place an order on line. I over-ruled her and went to the store in person to place the order. I placed three different orders, one of which was the sunflowers for my wife, the others to my mother-in-law and a special order from me of roses. They assured me that they would be delivered as requested, the arrangements I chose and on time (the day before Mother's Day). The children were excited and expecting their mother to get real enjoyment out of this arrangement. But, on Saturday morning I got a call on my cell from Flowers Unlimited at which time they informed me that they could not fill my order because they didn't actually have any sunflowers. I asked why they waited until the day before to let me know, and especially since I placed the order over a week prior. They had no answer or logical response.I drove to the store, expecting to either be reimbursed for the full charge of the sunflowers, or given some discount or consideration on another arrangement. Instead, they were less than apologetic and were seemingly reluctant to even provide me a refund. I decided to consider a different arrangement since time was running out and I saw another type that might be nice. The price they quoted (a half dozen roses) was even more expensive than the sunflowers. When I balked, they simply maintained they would remain at that price without any other consideration. I told them to process the refund.Meanwhile, my daughter who still wanted to try and buy the sunflowers for her mother, placed an order online. This order was as much as 20% more than the one I placed with Flowers Unlimited in person, but we just wanted to be sure we were able to get them. My daughter placed the on-line order and called the number offered, spoke with a representative - TWICE - who assured her that sunflowers were available from the store that they work with and that they would be delivered - same day.Well, they were delivered after a few hours. But the order delivered were NOT sunflowers. The delivering store: Flowers Unlimited. When I pointed this out to the delivery person they told me to call the store and speak to "Tony". Apparently they close down their "customer service" on certain days because the call was taken by a call-taker not at the store. I explained my problem to this individual who said no one could be contacted - at 4:00 pm on a Saturday - and I would have to wait until Sunday - Mother's Day. They claimed that it was essentially my fault because they didn't have any sunflowers and they substituted what they had, yet I PAID a premium price for an article I never received - even though I was assured - both in person and on the telephone. What's more, I paid more for a delivery I should have gotten in the first place at a much cheaper price.These people simply don't have a clue. It would make sense to check your inventory before you tell a customer that you have an item in stock. As soon as you discover a shortage, it should be incumbent upon the business to contact the customer so other arrangements could be made. The same goes for telephone/online transactions. In both cases it's like it was a "bait and switch." I would never do business with these people again. Even their attitude toward the customer was essentially "take it or leave it." There was no indication or concern about how this might affect the plans of the customers or the person for whom the flowers were intended. I'd rather go to the local Jewel's or some other established florist instead of these folks.Business people should be truthful with the customer - anything less is a business killer. Trust is an essential when it comes to something like this. I will now be about the business of warning my friends and family to NOT do business here again. It's not worth it.

0.description: I've been using Flowers Unlimited for years.They do a terrific job, even on short notice.Phone orders are taken accurately and they respect your financial requests as far as limits are concerned.  Deliveries are on time.This is the place to go (or call) as the case may be when you need good flowers that look great!  They also can provide a live plant if you prefer to send one of those.

4.description: Received a large candy basket for V Day from them, they left it at my neighbors house two doors down, which is weird since I live in an apt building and there were people at the apt building home..... Delivery on a Sunday, 8pm. No note saying who they were from, just my name, phone number and address. I called to find out who sent this and the person at the call center had no way of telling me anything about my candy basket. I have tried to call all day today and the two numbers have been busy.all.day.long. Signed, Frustrated.

3.description: I Had A O So Fab Time Mz. Shawneka Is Very Professional The Atmosphere Is Calm & Relaxing Overall A Wonderful Experience

1.description: Hmmmm, very unprofessional for a person to continuously be on her phone more than attending to her clients. She'll do a bit on ur nails, then go to texting, do a little more, then more texting.  Completely inappropriate.  Has anyone ever seen the guy in there do anyone's feet or nails?  He's just in there on twitter & fb & gossiping.  I was in there a few days ago & i got a waterless manicure when i asked for a water manicure so my nails can be properly done,  cuticles were not properly done,  etc.  Definitely won't be back.

2.description: I love Shawneka. She is professional, knowledgeable and cares about what she does. She's very nice too. She's good at what she does and I like that she won't do anything that she doesn't believe in just for the sake of a dollar. I just can't imagine letting anyone else do my manicures/pedicures anymore.

0.description: Shawneka also known as Shawn. Is an excellent nail tech she is licensed and a true professional in her craft!-Shawn is a true believer in healthy nails and healthy nail care (professional products, she will educate you on the products she is using no mystery bowls or chemicals here).-Shawn stands by her work, you will not leave her shop looking a mess, she cares about what you want and is not out to only take your money-Shawn is on time with her appts and will not treat you like a number as you see in asian nail shops.-Shawn has never nicked me or hurt my hands or feet, my pedicures last for almost a month and i I didn't have to get fill ins for my nails because they grow I could go almost a month with them as well.-Shawn has the freshest and seasonal OPI, Essie, Vegan, Morgan Taylor, etc nail polishes that are fresh and pretty new.- Shawn also does dry pedicures and manicures so that the color can stay even longer.-She makes lip sticks, glosses, brow kits that are of excellent pigment and quality -She does beautiful lash extensions that looks better that those cluster ones you get with the hard ass glue at the Asian nails shops. These lash extension actually look like the lashes are growing from your eye!Most people are afraid to try an African american owned and operated business, but I suggest you try Shawn she is so professional and he customer service is top notched, Trust me! Her services are top quality! and if you check her out tell her Mary a.k.a Butterfly sent you!Check out  her style seat to see her list and prices, pics!

1.description: One of the best natural hair care salons in Chicago. Ask for Jean, Alma or Cat. This team of hair artistry are reliable, friendly, professional and fast.  I'm never in the salon more than 2 hours. Jean is my loc specialists.  I have been his client for over 3 years.  My hair is vibrant, strong and healthy.  They give the best holiday nd anniversary parties.  Yummy drinks, yummy food and sexxy fun!

0.description: I love my cousins shop, it is very relaxing whenever I go there to get my locs done! I wouldn't go any where else. If you need your locs done and in done in a peaceful environment, go to Misunderstood Natural Hair Salon! Let's go!

3.description: They have really good big juicy burger. The fries are very well season with alot of side's and house special. The only Problem it take about 25 to 30 Minutes for anything and they never have chili at the end of day.  But the burgers are worth the wait. It's a hand made Patty that remind you of home and fries are point. Awesome place to eat. But make sure to call your order in at 3o minutes early or you will wait.

1.description: Get ready to wait, get ready to wait! By the time I left, I thought to myself I will never return. No hot links and No MILD sauce... Yep NO MILD SAUCE! I had to ask Grandma in the window are we on the south side or nah? lol So I ordered two polishes and fries. Thinking ordering something so simple would cut my wait time... My oh my, I waited 35 mins for 2 polishes and fried!!! Never again. I will stick with the location on 71st.

2.description: My husband had a burger craving and a good idea! Let's go to "That's a Burger" he said! I am not really a burger eater but I gave in. I called to see what time they closed and the line stayed busy! Finally, there was a voice on the the phone ready to take my order. I had NO idea what we wanted so I just checked closing time which is at 8, but they take there last order at 7:30.My husband and I decided on single burgers with cheese, grilled onions and everything. I was able to call it in after a few more busy signals. Then, we headed out. Parking sucks and there was a line. A great aroma hits you as soon as you enter. It was very nice and clean and the servers were friendly. We waited about 12 minutes for our order.Stole a few fries out the bag on our way home. They were like grandma made. Real potatoes, skin on and lightly seasoned. Couldn't wait to sit down and enjoy the burger. As I placed our burgers on plates I noticed the weight. These babies were heavy! We were both happy that we chose singles! At first bite you could tell this was hand shaped; it was perfectly seasoned, juicy! Oh my........that's a burger!

9.description: Made to order food requires made to order time.  The only downfall to excellent food is waiting   in the area surrounding the Restaurant.  I recall last year I was in Chicago and craving a turkey burger and the city police were standing on the corner with AR-15 assault rifles as I was leaving the restaurant. For some reason that image has not left my head. I love their food at That's A Burger, but location, location, location. I would really like to see this company expand to other areas of the country. I believe people would really love this food even if they have to wait additional time.

10.description: I love food, but owner/female,?would not accept my gift card because it had no name. I've used at Walgreens, she'll, mobile, cvs, et alALWAYS EXPECT 30-45 minute wait. They don't answer phone when busy

4.description: I love the turkey burgers here, the woman who takes the orders was pleasant. My only complaint is that it takes forever to get your food, there's no point of calling it in either BUT it is well worth it, the food is always hot and consistently good. They also have a large range of other items but I have only had the turkey burgers.

6.description: This location replaces the previous one on 71st Street, off of Merrill. There's still a long lead time, but they have one of THE best turkey burgers around! It comes well-dressed with lettuce, onion (grilled or raw), ketchup, mustard, mayo,tomato (if you ask), and pickles. Cheese is extra. The French fries are fresh-cut, and delicious! I ask for them to make mine crispy, and it usually turns out well. Everything is made to order, so to circumvent the 25-40 minute wait, call ahead. See? Disaster avoided. All this juicy deliciousness can be yours for under $7!

12.description: I give them 5 stars because their burgers are the best in Chicago!! Each burger is handmade. They do not use frozen patties. My only complaint is that it would have taken them a man hour in a half to make my burger. The lady that takes the order will inform you so that you can make a decision if you want to wait or not. Too long to wait for a burger but so worth the bite. Just not today!!

5.description: Would be no stars if possible food is good but owner obviously thinks it's ok to run out of numerous products and condiments for burgers (get this) at a burger joint! Funny last time they will receive my money! I HIGHLY SUGGEST NEVER SPENDING MONEY HERE BECAUSE OF THE COCKINESS I RECEIVED THEY DONT CARE ABOUT EVERYBODY MONEY!

13.description: Best burgers in the city. Bar none! Better call ahead though. Takes  25-45 minutes on average but worth it when that juice is running out of it.The number is actually (773)721-6777.

11.description: You will not find a better place on the southside for turkey burgers. This is a family owned business and the customer service is great. Because the food is cooked to order,  you should call ahead. The wait time can exceed 25 minutes. Believe  me,  it's worth the wait.

8.description: Fire ass burgers hands down oh you gonna wait but a must have its definitely a burger to eat on the southside its an hour wait tho so i like to call it Thats-a-burger..... That will get your ass fired l

0.description: I have been a customer since there were located on 71st street. In my past review, I spoke about improving their signage so that they can attract more customers. I don't know if they read my review but this is a better location. The turkey burgers are excellent. The burgers are moist, juicy, and delicious! I ordered the double turkey burger with fries.My only complaint is the long  wait for the orders. I know that quality takes time. So be prepared to wait 30 minutes. It will be worth it.PS. Parking is an issue. My advice is to park on the side street so that you can get out quicker.

7.description: I love this place they never let me down an they added on lots of new stuff that all is so damn good

0.description: Tia, still the best stylist ever!

1.description: This is my favorite shop. They have vision and just overall good vibes and energy that lead to beyond amazing styles. They keep my hair healthy and as a result it's growing like crazy. The styles are so amazing that people stop me in the streets all the time and ask me where I get my hair done. The decor of the shop is superb and there is a kitchen in the back. Another great thing is that they are flexible. I tell Chris I have a job interview and what type of company and he comes up with the most beautiful but appropriate hair style for each interview.

9.description: My fiancee is getting ready for medical school, and wanted a place to maintain his locks and help them to start looking more "professional". Ive looked up maybe 10 different salons trying to find the perfect place for him to go. Our first time here was great other than his appointment being scheduled for 11 and not being seen until 12, we live in carol stream and after and hour trip waiting an hour to see a stylist is somewhat upsetting. Other than that we ate a great breakfast in the restaurant in the back, everybody is very professional, and the salon has a nice atmosphere. We'll be back for sure.

23.description: Okay okay I really like this salon :) So, Christian Fields called me at my office because he found out about the debaucle that happened last weekend. He made a special color for me and Larenzo gave me the most beautiful color oh my goodness. Nia washed my hair and curled it she was very sweet and funny. Christian Fields as an owner and Larenzo as a colorist are artists. Larenzo explained each step to me and literally painted the highlights and gradient color onto my hair LITERALLY. I got five star treatment and I loved it. I didn't realize this but they also have a shop downstairs that sells shea butter and frangrance oil as well as a delicious smelling cafe of sorts on the main floor that sells made to order turkey burgers and jerk chicken.I am fasting so I didn't taste the chicken but it smelled wonderful. I did buy some shea butter and incense from downstairs and I they are wonderful.

5.description: I love this place and my new hair cut! After my first big chop I was worried about styles but I've been here twice for a wash & style. Leaving with fabulous twist and coils  in my natural hair. Thanks M. J, my stylist & friend !!!

25.description: I no longer go to this salon since my stylist is at a new location and i didn't notice other stylists doing non-lock styles. If you have locks, it definitely seems like the place to be.  It's a clean, well kept salon.

12.description: Go check out my boy Lorenzo. He cool peoples n he does a phenomenal wash n retwist. Shoutout to Byron for the style

21.description: It is often said not to mix business with pleasure. At Christian Fields natural hair salon the opposite philosophy is practiced. Christian Fields Style Bar believes in giving you the best Salon experience. Clients are treated like family at the Cottage Grove salon. Christian wanted to choose an ordinary neighborhood to do extraordinary things. By bringing a richness to the Cottage Grove neighborhood in entreprenuership and quality service, Christian has maintained a wonderful rapport within the Southside community as a hardworker and dedicated owner of Christian Fields Style Bar Salon. Christian Fields is a cornucopia for new naturally intended folk, specializing in all styles of natural hair from locks, bantu knots, fades, tapers, strawsets, coils, relaxed styles and colors. The juicebar and style lounge is a nice space for lounging and grabbing a quick meal before your appointment.

16.description: Okay okay I really like this salon :) So, Christian Fields called me at my office because he found out about the debaucle that happened last weekend. He made a special color for me and Larenzo gave me the most beautiful color oh my goodness. Nia washed my hair and curled it she was very sweet and funny. Christian Fields as an owner and Larenzo as a colorist are artists. Larenzo explained each step to me and literally painted the highlights and gradient color onto my hair LITERALLY. I got five star treatment and I loved it. I didn't realize this but they also have a shop downstairs that sells shea butter and frangrance oil as well as a delicious smelling cafe of sorts on the main floor that sells made to order turkey burgers and jerk chicken.I am fasting so I didn't taste the chicken but it smelled wonderful. I did buy some shea butter and incense from downstairs and I they are wonderful.

17.description: They take good care of me here! Love the atmosphere, the stylists are really chill and the chef is good in the kitchen!

10.description: I always leave here feeling great!, thanks to my natural hair styling gene Chris Fields

11.description: I had my locs colored and styled last week... and my style still looks good. I have received so many compliments on my new color and style! The Style Bar has such a warm feeling, staff members are friendly and professional chic! I would have never selected the style Christian did for me, however I trusted him and it came out great! I highly recommend the Style Bar... you get what you pay for!

26.description: This shop is great for hair designs.  That's how I came to the shop.   When I saw people with a nice design they would say Christian Fields.  The style bar is nice as well.  This is the end of the positives.The negatives are:  TIME.  I would be in there all day.  It did not matter whether I had a scheduled appt or walked in.  I would get bumped.  Even after scheduling to be the first client they ended up scheduling someone before me.  The amount of time is a big turn off.As well I was on a regular appt but had death in the family.  I tried calling 3 times...they went over to an automated system.  Noone called back.  I have also emailed them.  Noone has called back.Third they put this heavy guck in your hair made by Christian.  It's okay but just a little over the top.  It takes me several of days and sleeping on a towel for that stuff to wear off some.Last the changeover in staff.  I have had various people work on my head because they are all supposedly trained by Chris.  They come and go, get training and go do their own thing.  So it's hard to build a relationship with one person.Trendy it is but as far as customer service AWFUL.

27.description: After frequenting Christian Fields on several occasions, I must say...I am pleased.  I am always treated with respect by Christian and his stylists, my appointments start on time, it is a very relaxed environment, and the loc services are superior.  I wish the salon the best success for many years to come.

0.description: I took my fiancée in for a surprise appointment. This was her first visit to a hair Salon in almost ten years! (She does her own hair usually and a great job too). The shop seems to specialize in locs but they also do natural hair styles and weaves. When I called to set up the appointment for her, I was greeted with a friendly woman who walked me through setting up the appointment and the stylist. When we arrived we were greeted with a lively but comfortable atmosphere. No stylist were upstairs at the time and we were directed down stairs. The shop looks well maintained both up and downstairs. When we got downstairs we found out that the stylist who was suppose to do her hair was not there yet. However, all of the other stylist were friendly and one even went an extra step to contact the stylist and see where she was and when she would be there.After the stylist arrived (kinda late due to some miscommunication on both the shop and my end) she was pleasant and very apologetic. Although I did not stay, my fiancée said the experience was amazing and she would def come back. Michelle was the stylist she saw and I must say, she did an amazing job! I guess they just gained a new customer.

20.description: My husband and I both have locs and Dustin is our stylist.  My oldest daughter has natural hair and Candryce is her stylist.  We all have different needs.  My husband usually goes first thing is the morning in by 7am or 8am and he is back at work by 10am.  I on the other hand,  usually like my locs in intricate styles especially when I have formal events.  I am very particular about my Bantu Knots. LOL !!  Dustin does a great job and always gives me exactly what I want.My daughter is in highschool and is still learning how to take care of her natural hair. Candryce does a wonderful job interacting with her and gives her fun vibrant styles.All the stylist at the shop are well-traned and function as a team.  The food in the cafe is excellent and made fresh daily. I highly recommend Christian Fields Style Bar.  If you are on the fence about starting locs. Take the leap an head over to 65th and Cottage Grove.

19.description: Why have I waited so long to sing the praises of my stylist, the best locktician in Chicago?  Shahid has been doing my hair for about 6 years, and he has clearly spoiled me because I have yet to find a salon home in Atlanta.  Whenever I go home, he is one of the first people I see.Positives: 1. PROFESSIONALISM: When you have a 2pm appointment with Shahid, you are in the shampoo bowl at 2pm.  This is a man who knows how to respect your time!  He works quickly and efficiently.  Also, he is a gentleman.  Shop talk is always positive, and he is never distracted.  In all these years, never a personal call, drama, or even remotely inappropriate comment.2. Skills and products: Organic, simple recipes: no mystery products.3. Atmosphere: I've followed Shahid to a few locations, and Christian Fields is the best so far.  It is clean, well lit, and spacious.  Only one negative: No parking.

2.description: I don't often write Yelp reviews, but I felt particularly strongly about writing one regarding my experience with Christian Fields Style Bar.I've been trying, to no avail, to make an appointment for color for over a week. I just wanted information of whether or not I needed to give a deposit, or perhaps go through a consultation appointment, but I can't even reach anyone to advise me. I have been told that I need to speak with one specific person who hasn't returned my calls, and who has not called me back after leaving my information for her with reception. It's one of the most frustrating experiences I've had with a business in quite awhile. If I were on a tight timeline, I would have been completely out of luck.Not sure if I'll ever be able to truly weigh to verify the all of wonderfulness that people sing CF Style Bar's praises for, but I will say this - they must be doing very well, as it doesn't seem at all that they are interested in/in need of new business. Wish me luck on my journey to find a loc colorist! (I'll apparently need it!)

18.description: It is often said not to mix business with pleasure. At Christian Fields natural hair salon the opposite philosophy is practiced. Christian Fields Style Bar believes in giving you the best Salon experience. Clients are treated like family at the Cottage Grove salon. Christian wanted to choose an ordinary neighborhood to do extraordinary things. By bringing a richness to the Cottage Grove neighborhood in entreprenuership and quality service, Christian has maintained a wonderful rapport within the Southside community as a hardworker and dedicated owner of Christian Fields Style Bar Salon. Christian Fields is a cornucopia for new naturally intended folk, specializing in all styles of natural hair from locks, bantu knots, fades, tapers, strawsets, coils, relaxed styles and colors. The juicebar and style lounge is a nice space for lounging and grabbing a quick meal before your appointment.

13.description: I have been taking my daughter here off and on for around two years now.  Candryce always has her looking beautiful when I pick her up.  My son gets his hair cut there now and then.  My children are young, 8 and 10, so I'm picky about where I take them.  Barbershops especially can be rated X(tra).  I always feel great about having my children in such a diverse setting.  The people who work there and the patrons seem to be very positive.  The salon is beautiful and clean.  I love the kitchen idea, I've purchased food for my children there on occasion.  As far as professionalism I've always been treated with respect and received great customer service from the front desk.  I am about to transition out of relaxes hair and I can guarantee you I will go to Christian Fields to stay stylish while I transition.  I am about to book another appointment right now!

4.description: Nice salon.

24.description: Why have I waited so long to sing the praises of my stylist, the best locktician in Chicago?  Shahid has been doing my hair for about 6 years, and he has clearly spoiled me because I have yet to find a salon home in Atlanta.  Whenever I go home, he is one of the first people I see.Positives: 1. PROFESSIONALISM: When you have a 2pm appointment with Shahid, you are in the shampoo bowl at 2pm.  This is a man who knows how to respect your time!  He works quickly and efficiently.  Also, he is a gentleman.  Shop talk is always positive, and he is never distracted.  In all these years, never a personal call, drama, or even remotely inappropriate comment.2. Skills and products: Organic, simple recipes: no mystery products.3. Atmosphere: I've followed Shahid to a few locations, and Christian Fields is the best so far.  It is clean, well lit, and spacious.  Only one negative: No parking.

6.description: This place is awesome. The customer service is on point. I have been here a few times and each time the experience is pleasurable. I have been getting my hair done at natural hair salons for years in multiple states, and this is definitely an experience I have never had before. There are plenty of staff members around , providng all types of hair services, and they all work together well.

22.description: My last review of the Christian Fields Style Bar was pretty rough because the customer service was so bad. But then... the owner, Christian Fields, caught wind of my wife's experience and worked really hard to fix it. He offered to provide the services for free or pay for her to go somewhere else. This gesture proved to me that he does not support bad customer service and values his patrons. Which for me makes all of the difference. She went back and got the red carpet treatment and loved it. Mr. Fields you are all right with me :-)  Everyone makes mistakes... its all about how you fix them.

15.description: My husband and I both have locs and Dustin is our stylist.  My oldest daughter has natural hair and Candryce is her stylist.  We all have different needs.  My husband usually goes first thing is the morning in by 7am or 8am and he is back at work by 10am.  I on the other hand,  usually like my locs in intricate styles especially when I have formal events.  I am very particular about my Bantu Knots. LOL !!  Dustin does a great job and always gives me exactly what I want.My daughter is in highschool and is still learning how to take care of her natural hair. Candryce does a wonderful job interacting with her and gives her fun vibrant styles.All the stylist at the shop are well-traned and function as a team.  The food in the cafe is excellent and made fresh daily. I highly recommend Christian Fields Style Bar.  If you are on the fence about starting locs. Take the leap an head over to 65th and Cottage Grove.

7.description: Excellent experience. My first visit was a loc start with Kerry who appeared to be very professional, neat and knowledgeable. He made the process a breeze. The clean cozy environment provided a lot of comfort for me as well. Also, the young lady who washed my hair, Ronnie, was extremely sweet and open for discussion. Her touch was GREAT. I felt a great sense of teamwork amongst these representatives. I truly admire that. Based on the interaction I shared with these 2 and the results I saw from the loc start, I WILL be returning once a month.

8.description: I moved to Chicago about a year ago and was in need of a salon.  I was so use to my hair stylist in DC and was nervous to try anyone else. I asked around and was given two salons names and one of the names was: Christian Fields Salon. I went to the salon for a visit for the first time and spoke to a gentleman named Shaheed. He was very nice, polite, patient and answered all of my questions pertaining to my hair.  I left feeling as though I would give them a try soon but was still hesitant. I went back to the salon a few months later and spoke to the owner, Christian Fields.  Chris was very professional and was very knowledgeable about hair. I was impressed with his knowledge of hair from the start. He actually informed me that the last stylist that styled and maintained my locs had actually damaged them. I was shocked! I had been going to this stylist for over 5 years. He immediately explained to me how my hair was damaged, went through a step by step process of how he would rebuild and strengthen my hair back to my natural state. Almost one year later and I am still going to Chris for loc maintenance. Chris is the real deal! He has several hair licenses and certificates. He is God sent. Please try Christian Fields if you want healthy locs, fantastic styles, professional atmosphere, healthy meals and the Christian Fields experience. I have gotten so many compliments from strangers and have referred so many people to this salon. Please try them!

3.description: I will highly recommend this shop to anyone. Christian is very knowledge and his expertise of natural hair is top notch. I was blown away by the customer service the staff also provides.

14.description: My last review of the Christian Fields Style Bar was pretty rough because the customer service was so bad. But then... the owner, Christian Fields, caught wind of my wife's experience and worked really hard to fix it. He offered to provide the services for free or pay for her to go somewhere else. This gesture proved to me that he does not support bad customer service and values his patrons. Which for me makes all of the difference. She went back and got the red carpet treatment and loved it. Mr. Fields you are all right with me :-)  Everyone makes mistakes... its all about how you fix them.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Extensions, Coloring

12.description: It was just ok!! Gwon Lee is better and it's just down the street on 87th. It's across from Walgreens and next to the black owned health food store!

7.description: Some of the best Chinese food in Chi-Town. Shrimp fried rice and Mongolian Chicken are my favorite!

3.description: It's been a while since I've visited Hoe Toy, but the food was good.  This time I stopped and picked up duck with noodle, shrimp fried rice, and shrimp chop suey. I'm still looking for the shrimp that was supposed to be in the fried rice and chop suey.  I think if you list shrimp as an ingredient there should be at least a hint or flavor of shrimp. But there was NONE!! it's safe to say I will not try this restaurant again!!  I'm giving this one star because there's no option for zero stars.

1.description: Shanghai lo mein combo is my new favorite. I've been coming here for about six years now. Great service

2.description: I love Hoe Toy. Been coming here ever since I was a kid. Love the food. The best chicken wings and egg rolls.

9.description: Its my favorite neighborhood chinese spot.  They just don't take credit or debit. These folks are all about cash and don't have an ATM inside either. Come prepared if you want good food cause you have to resort back to paper money.

10.description: Good food and prices are average. Only thing I don't like from them is the crab ragoon (fishy taste) but other than that, it's all to the good!

13.description: I was in the neighborhood today and stopped in an old fav Hoe Toy. I ordered the Shrimp/Lobster Sause anad to my suprise, I received shrimp/ a small amt of lobster doppings in thick brown gravy. I guess that they figured that the AA community would not know better!! Shame on them, I am returning to Chinatown.

16.description: This is great Chinese food better than most. No tables because it is "take out" Which is cool because it's good and they give you so much of whatever rice you buy they have to force the top closed. The egg rolls are fat with plenty of pork, beef, shrimp, chicken, etc. Everything I've had has been great. I've been going there for 30 years and it is still the best!

17.description: No one has done a review for Hoe Toy?!?!  Well, I'll be the first then.  If you can overlook the fact that you have to order your food through a bulletproof window and that they only take cash, you're in for a real treat.  The food here is REALLY good.  Seriously some of the best Chinese food in the city.  It's a hidden gem because it's not in yuppieville.  They're open pretty late and it's carryout only.  Being that they have bulletproof glass, I'm guessing they don't want people sitting in there so there's no tables.  They give you a crapload of fortune cookies too.  That's gotta count for something.  And c'mon, everyone wants to say they've eaten at a restuarant with the word Ho in the title.

15.description: This is best Chinese food spot on the southeast side of Chicago. They have the best shrimp fried rice. They give you nice sized shrimp and the food is seasoned just right. They only except cash that the only minus they have. Its best to call in your order to avoid a wait on the weekend. There is plenty of street parking on Stony Island.  Everytime I go there the food has been consistent.

0.description: Haven't been here since I moved from South Chicago in 2011 but the food here was seriously good! Yeah, the place is a little "hole in the wall" but that's where you get the best food! It's small and there aren't any places to sit down but don't let that stop you from going. Get your food, get out and enjoy!

5.description: How I use to love this place until I had to file a missing report on my shrimps in my fried rice.  Being that finding a good Chinese Restaurant on the southside of Chicago is like finding a needle in a haystack, I have always opted for Hoe Toy...until they toyed with my food!I don't expect to find a shrimp fest in my fried rice, but I do expect "some" - more than 5 shrimps to reside in Fried Rice Town!!!However, the staff is always friendly - but I want my fried rice to be shrimp-friendly as well!  (Can you tell I feel some type of way about the disappearing shrimp? - lol)

11.description: Someone said to order from here and when I went to go pick up the food, I was absolutely disgusted by how dirty the entry door was and the inside was no better.  Filthy!  Not sure how anyone would feel comfortable eating from an establishment that has no signs of cleanliness - I certainly cannot. Try Kams on 83rd/Dan Ryan.  Clean establishment, good food (and tons of it) and friendly people.

8.description: Hoe Toy is a good Chinese food place to have around the corner. The prices make sense, and my favorite dishes are the Mongolian beef and shrimp and broccoli.  The people that work there are friendly, and the food doesn't take too long.  Downer cash only lol. Otherwise, if you're in the area get some Hoe Toy

4.description: For neighborhood Chinese food, this isnt bad at all. The prices are affordable and they give you a lot of food. I have no idea why they charge you for extra sauce packets, but whatever...everyone's gotta make a buck, I guess :) its best to call ahead as they take some time to get your order together. But i like having my food made to order as opposed to sitting on some heat lamp all day.

14.description: This is not the place it used to be in the 90's and early 2000's. The flavor of this food has gone completely down the drain. The shrimp fried rice used to be so flavorful with just enough oil. Now it's dry and flavorless. The orange chicken... ewe! It had too much of a tangy after taste and the pineapples do not mix well in the dish. The crab Rangoon was also disgusting. It was too chewy and it had a weird old fish taste in it. I miss the days when Hoe Toy trumped over all the Chinese restaurants on the south side. Those days are clearly over.

6.description: I thought this place had good chinese food. I had order from here several times in the last couple of months until one day when i ordered a large shrimp egg foo young my food was not all the way cooked through.  The egg was running in the inside of the patty. I returned it back to the restaurant and there was someone else was there with the same problem demanding their money back as well.  No more eating there for me.

3.description: This is my first time reviewing the company. The people who run it are nice but this is about their business.I have only been to Glo On Braids twice and unfortunately I won't be returning because they are getting too expensive. Don't get me wrong, they do a good job on the hair but I am not made of money and at some point you have to question what you are really getting for your money. The first time I went the cost for mid back Senegalese twists was $200 in September or October of 2013. The cost for the same hair-do in February 2014 is $250 which is now really out of my price range. I understand that prices have to increase for inflation but a $50 increase is ridiculous. Now I don't have a lot of experience with getting my hair braided/twisted  and so I went with Glo On because they had really good reviews. Everyone seems to have an opinion of what makes a hair braider good and all I knew was that this place had good reviews and they weren't too difficult to get to. Something else that bugged me besides the price was willing to write off is the experience. When you have someone sitting in a chair for up to 6 hours and the client is paying you a lot of money I think it is courteous to offer them refreshments such as water and it also can't hurt to apologize if you are delayed by something.The last time I went I think that my spot was overbooked because at one point there were 3 people at once waiting to have there hair done including myself (though she did have an assistant). At some times I was left sitting waiting for long periods of time because she was working on other people. Shavon started doing my hair at 9:30 but I didn't get out of her office until 6pm. It is in the south loop off of Wabash and Roosevelt Road.I don't have a lot of experience with hair braiders so I thought I had found a winner that I would return to for years to come. That all changed when she increased her prices. I recently found an alternative that I can use next time who can do it for much cheaper for the same result.

1.description: I had a great experience at Glo On and will be returning to her for braids in the future. Shavon was pleasant and we had friendly conversation. I didn't get my hair washed and tried to blow dry it but I do wish it was blown out more because my hair (which is kinky curly) cam be seen through the braids. I know for next time to get it washed/blown out there.Other than that, I love my braids and the location is SUPER convenient, in the south loop. I'll be back!

2.description: I was happy to be in Shavon's chair again. I love my yarn twists. The atmosphere is peaceful and easy to relax in. Shavon truly works her magic and takes care of your hair.

5.description: My cousin has been natural for almost 10 years but never went to a professional stylist. She was getting married and I insisted that she have her hair done professionally. We went to 3 consultations. Glo On won hands down! They we're very patient during the free consult and used her hair to show samples of different styles they could achieve. Upon leaving they set up a tentative appointment with us in their computer system and said they would follow up to see what we decided. We had a horrible experience at another natural hair salon named Chatoo, which charged us a consultation fee knowing they wouldn't be available for the date we needed the hair done and the simple style we requested was going to cost a ridiculous amount. We hurriedly left and finally confirmed our appointment with Glo On. From that time on they were constantly in communication with us. They confirmed different hairstyles and hair accessories. The appointment they gave us started exactly on time and they finished 2 hours earlier than the initial estimate. But with the speed they did not sacrifice the quality. The hair turned out beautiful!! It was exactly like our vision and the price was so reasonable. Thank you Glo On for a wonderful experience. We will be back!

6.description: I had a great experience today. I moved from CA looking for someone to do loc maintenance with a latch hook for micro-locs and Glo On came to the rescue. The products smelled great, the conversation was friendly, and my hair looks great!

7.description: Customer service SUCKS!!!!! I had a consultation with Shavon and was very excited about getting my hair done...After the consultation, I got no response from her. I called and left a message on her VM then I reached out to her on Facebook - NO RESPONSE. What I found funny is, FB will let you know when a person reads your messages and needless to say she read my message 20 minutes after I reached out to her. I'm very glad that I didn't purchase the hair from her ($200), because I would be stuck in a rut being that she won't return calls. Good luck to anyone needing to get their hair done by her, I guess she's too busy for new clients.

8.description: I have been going to Glo on Braids for about 6 months now and will look no further for anyone else to care for my hair. Shavon is every efficient and works at a speedy rate. She braids very neat and does not pull tight. I have been consistently getting my hair braided for 6 months and still have strong healthy edges. Shavon does a beautiful job and I recommend her for natural hair care and styling services.

0.description: Shavon is my go to natural hair stylist because she is creative and gentle. She's the best around in my opinion.

4.description: "I really enjoyed my visit to Glo On Braids. The environment was relaxing and my finished style looked great. My braids were neatly done but not too tight such as my past experiences with braided styles. I will be a returning customer. Thanks Shavon for a job well done!

3.description: If I could give zero stars I would.  I ordered oxtails and had high hopes they would be good.  Unfortunately they were scorched and pitch black in color.   I really wish I had checked my food before I left.  My destination was too far for me to go back with the food.      I don't understand how whoever prepared my food even gave out food in this condition.      I will NEVER go back.

1.description: Finally a jerk spot that is on point not named Jerk Villa. This is a Hidden gem on the south side of Stony!

2.description: Okay...... Now after Jamaican Jerk Villa 2 on State/Cermack burned down late last year I have been looking for a back-up!. Just can't get to 79th easily and keep hearing horror stories about the lines now......So a co-worker mentioned them to me and she compared it to good Ole Jamaican Jerk Villa (which I got her hooked on). She said they were very good and had just had them not too long ago. Well, I called it in and was told 15 minutes.  I gave it extra time as we know you have to especially working with Villa all these years!.I get there and it's ready, heavy and wrapped!!!!  I was VERY surprised, like WOW!.... Okay...great start. I get it home after a long ride home. I open it and it's PIPING HOT!!... "Oh Snap"!!.... (In my Carl voice)!.... Man LISTEN........ I tore  a freakin hole in that food. Dang NEAR gluttoned myself.... I was like, "This taste like freakin Villa."I told my guy Tone about the place, him and his wife went.  They bof not "both" (B.O.F.) TORE THEIR'S UP!!.... So the next time I go, I get my order, everything goes the same way as last time. It's ready and I'm on-time. Upon leaving I see a bottle of Villa seasoning in the window. I was like, "Yup, it's Villa". The only difference is the how the chop their cabbage and the gravy for the rice and beans. The cabbage is still on-point. The gravy is a little different but still good.I paid them yet ANOTHER visit a couple of weeks ago and saw my man working. He used to grille the chicken at the original Villa. In fact Tone told me he seen him in the back when him and his wife came. He remembered me, I asked him about everybody at Villa and they are actually all family and STILL doing great. I recently sent my sister there for some catering.Outside of original Villa on 79th street and Cermak/State and forthcoming 22nd and Michigan Ave. THIS IS HANDS DOWN MY GO-TO!!.. Word-Is-Bond yo, it is a GO!.Goneee.............-JV

5.description: OMG...soooooo good!huge portions..friendly staff..great food..great prices..its 13 miles and 2 buses for me to get there and worth every minute! So Sorry, Mr. Browns Lounge...take lessons from Jamaican Jerk Palace !!

0.description: My husband was hesitant to try this place because he only goes to Jerk Villa and Uncle Joes, but it's close so we gave it a try. Love it!!!The food is good, they are pretty quick getting it out!

4.description: BEST jerk on the SouthSide!!!! Ordered a pan of chicken for a party recently and everybody wanted to know where I got it from. The price is right and the service has gotten faster since they opened.

3.description: I really liked my experience here. I got an SNS dip manicure on Monday and it's still looking great (highly recommend these over no chip if you have thin nails). The tech was wonderful and fixed up one of my broken/cracked nails without having to put a tip on it and it's still holding up beautifully. It's not exactly the fanciest nail place, it is a little cluttered, they don't offer water, soft drinks, etc. but places that do SNS manicures are few and far between. I'm going to go in for a pedi tomorrow and see how it goes. I normally go to Cuticle in Uptown, a very impeccably clean, chic salon, but just moved to the south side and love dip manicures a lot more than no chip.

1.description: I was looking for a place in the area and noticed this spot from the street. I went in just to check out the environment and I can say I was happy that it was very inviting and above all clean. I would of loved to stay for a mani and pedi but I needed a quick manicure for an event in a few hours. I was seated immediately and they have an awesome selection of colors. I look forward to going back and making this my south/Eastside go to.

2.description: Nice salon. Has all the necessities with a great variety of services. The staff there is really friendly and their work has made me a loyal customer whenever I'm in town. I tried the SNS manicure for the first time and, again, I've been converted. It's remarkable. I highly recommend this salon. If you're in a rush, however, don't go on the weekend. They don't accept appointments Th-Sat and are quite busy.

0.description: I love this nail shop and it was my first time going there. It is very clean and you don't smell fumes at all. The shop is airy and bright. They use OPI products which are my favorite. Lyn did my nails and we discussed politics and Donald Trump. Lol. My nails are immaculate and not thick at the ends. Lyn gave me a card to fill up 10 times and then I would get a 10.00 discount. I hope I can add my pictures so that you can see for yourself what an excellent job she did. This is my new nail stop and I highly recommend you going there. Now you may wait a little bit but it's well worth it.

3.description: Overall, it was a great experience. I called the night before and was able to come in the next day. Kevin (owner) and Terrell, the loctician were friendly and very professional. I enjoyed the music and there are good places to eat close by, if you get hungry. I do plan on returning.

1.description: The staff here is very very friendly. The shop is also easy to find. I got my hair done but the twists were just way too small and my hair was a little on the greasy side. It also took hours to do my hair which isn't expected for two strand twists. All in all, I would still recommend this establishment to people.

2.description: My first experience was a great experience.  I called on a late Friday afternoon hoping (fingers crossed) that I would be able to get an appointment the same evening.  The owner, Kevin, was determined to get me seen and worked his magic!  Twenty minutes later, I was at the salon asking for Will.  Will did a fantastic loc maintenance and style for me. His technique is amazing.  It was also a pleasure speaking with him during my service.  Nice spot.  I will definitely return!

0.description: So far so good on my first visit. I spoke to the owner who was extremely helpful and friendly to get me an appointment with the loctician of my choice. The salon is warm and inviting with good music playing... Plus there is parking!!!! 4  stars so far... I'll review again after my Locs get some much needed love!!!!

4.description: I get my locs professionally done by Will Williams. A lot of these experienced locticians are Christian fields alumi's.Nice music , nice amosphere. Your locs will be reborn once you let Will hook you up.

attributes.Hair Types Specialized In: African-American Hair, Curly Hair, Perms, Extensions

58.description: I got my tattoo here over a week ago by Zach Stuka. This was my very first tattoo and the only shop I checked out. Zach is really great and easy to work with! I didn't really have a picture in mind, I just told him what I wanted, how big, colors, etc. I didn't see the final design until the day of, but what he created was perfect and was exactly what I wanted! He was also very helpful with the aftercare process too. I had to wait about a month before I could get it done because he was all booked, but it definitely was worth the wait. Everyone here is so nice and approachable. Definitely the place to go to get a tattoo.

56.description: Before there were camera phones, before the iPad, before selfies, before hybrid cars, I won $200 on video poker slots (when they still paid out in change) and got my first tattoo.  Admittedly, it was a tramp stamp.  Admittedly, I did shots of tequila to give me liquid courage.   At that time, I fell for the "tattoos are addicting" and got another set of tattoos next to the first tattoo when I was at a tattoo convention.  I almost passed out in front of thousands of people.Needless to say, I was hesitant to get another because I didn't know what I wanted.   Fast forward 13 years, and I was ready.  I knew what I wanted, mostly on the where, and was recommended to Deluxe by a few people.  I initially had considered a different artist, but Troy was available when I wanted to go.  He was very patient with me while we worked out where it would go, how it was going to look, and what font I wanted to use, and was done within an hour.  I am very happy with my new tattoo and will going back to Troy for my next one.Why one less star?  Because I contacted the other artist via email, and needless to say, the response was a rather curt "just call to set up a consultation."  I think it should be clearer on the website who needs consultations, what their hours are, etc.  Just a thought.

29.description: My current artist is Jason Longtin. He is the only artist who has worked on my ink at Deluxe Tattoo - and though I would trust almost every artist employed here given their excellent portfolios - I will continue to get my ink done by Mr. Longtin, for as long as I can. His sketching is phenomenal and his outline and shadowing work is unlike anything I've ever seen. His attention to detail is eerily fascinating and his dedication to the job is outstanding. For my second inking, he took up on a cover-up that (too) many shied away from - and has not only done amazing work, but surpassed all expectations as well. Furthermore, he is always more than willing to listen to your ideas and concerns and will brainstorm with you until his design meets his standards and yours. Thanks Deluxe for being my ink home in Chicago! 'Til next time.XoXo

42.description: I think a lot of ppl that comment saying they arent treated well, felt ignored and judged etc just have confidence and self esteem issues. Every time I walk in here at least 3 or 4 people greet me. Most tattoo artists have been working on their craft before tattoos were a mainstream phenomenon. I dont feel sorry for ppl following a craze that know nothing about the culture but think that they arent treated with the utmost respect. you dont know shit. Dont cry like a baby if you cant get exactly what you want. listen to the artists they know what they are talking about. Good tattoos are expensive. Dont be cheap tip 20% - 30% at the least.  ok on with the review.. best tattoo shop in Chicago I recommend ZACH STUKA who has tattooed me 4 times 2 coverups. Tons of talent here I would say check out the Instagram page to find which artist matches the style you want. Every 1 in here is cool I'm always cracking up listening to them. Awesome artwork everywhere. Clean as hell. great music and fair pricing. Go to Deluxe Tattoo.

23.description: Loved my experience. Went in with my friend yesterday for her appointment to see if they could take me as a walk in and they were very friendly and courteous. Troy did my tattoo and was so great. He's amazingly talented! I showed him one picture of the outline I was thinking and one of the type of shading I wanted. I wasn't too sure with my wording since it was my first tattoo. He took my simple suggestions and came back 10 mins later with exactly what I had in mind. He made sure I was completely satisfied with sizing, placement etc before he started. He made sure I was at ease and knew to breathe normally and whatnot. Again, this being my first tattoo I was extremely nervous and he was very nice about it and it was over before I knew it. He took his time and was very detailed and thorough with after care instructions. It was around 20-30 mins total. Overall the shop was organized, clean, and friendly. I'm absolutely thrilled with my first tattoo and think it turned out beautiful! I would definitely recommend the shop to anyone looking for a good quality tattoo and would absolutely go back to Troy for another one!

47.description: Awesome place to get a tattoo. Very friendly and professional staff. I worked with Jimmy and he was very patient in getting the tattoo aligned and sized just right.Highly recommend going here to get your tattoo.

8.description: My current artist is Jason Longtin. He is the only artist who has worked on my ink at Deluxe Tattoo - and though I would trust almost every artist employed here given their excellent portfolios - I will continue to get my ink done by Mr. Longtin, for as long as I can. His sketching is phenomenal and his outline and shadowing work is unlike anything I've ever seen. His attention to detail is eerily fascinating and his dedication to the job is outstanding. For my second inking, he took up on a cover-up that (too) many shied away from - and has not only done amazing work, but surpassed all expectations as well. Furthermore, he is always more than willing to listen to your ideas and concerns and will brainstorm with you until his design meets his standards and yours. Thanks Deluxe for being my ink home in Chicago! 'Til next time.XoXo

31.description: I got my first tattoo here and Troy Taylor did a great job of helping me to design exactly what I was looking for. I would recommend his work to anyone. Very professional.

34.description: This shop is wonderful.. Bunny was my artist and he did a phenomenal job.. With over 13 years of experience he is gentle handed , very professional down to earth, great at placement quick and talented..He listened  very  well to what I wanted and gave very professional  opinions. . I also like that he made fine lines to make my piece delicate to flow with my other tattoos. .His prices are very reasonable too. Everyone at deluxe was very friendly,seemed to like to be at work and busy.. The shop was very clean and the receptionist was friendly... I am very pleased with Bunny's work and will be back!! :) :)

16.description: My brother and I went in to get tattoos today. Everyone was extremely helpful. Jim was our artist he was a great listener and a talented artist. He had us in and out in no time. We both are extremely happy with our tattoo I would recommend Deluxe and Jim to anyone!

13.description: Got a tattoo here from Stephanie and had an awesome experience. The shop is clean and comfortable. Stephanie was easy going and accommodating from the day of the consultation. She worked with me very willingly on the design and the finished product looks absolutely gorgeous. I will absolutely be going back to her in the future.

11.description: I came here after the recommendation of some friends when my friend and I were planning to go get a tattoo. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming right as we walked in. I had an idea of what I wanted and came in with a few designs that I wanted to pull bits and pieces from for a new, original piece. My artist drew up a design and we got going. The whole process was easy and I felt very comfortable the entire time. Everything was super clean and all my needs were accommodated. It's been about a week and the tattoo is healing perfectly. Will definitely be back!

39.description: My last tattoo was about 8 years ago, in Savannah, GA. So when I decided it was time to get some new ink in this area, I asked some good friends where they acquired their fantastic ink. "Deluxe Tattoo" they said, and pointed me in the direction of the great Ben Wahhh. Ben was great to work with, from start to finish. Actually, I can't say that, because we're not finished, but... from start to mid point. =) I'll be coming back for more, don't worry. Anyway, we set up the initial consultation and I gave him my ideas, and we set a date some time in the future so I could save my pretty pennies for this piece. I am a woman with a budget, after all. Then, disaster struck, winter arrived and the annual furnace breakdown occurred. Ben was super understanding for my need to reschedule for, yet again, a date pretty far off in the future. By the time May rolled around, we had another consultation. For a minute I thought it had been so long that he had forgotten who I was and what I even wanted, but he had not! He even had my original pictures I had brought him 8 months earlier! We hammered out the details and I (impatiently) waited one week for the big day.  When I walked in the door, a walk in was going just ahead of me. Worry not, ladies and gents, because it was the fastest tattoo I've ever seen done, (and I assume it looked nice because the girl looked quite happy) and I was back in the chair in mere minutes. He showed me the amazing art he had drawn for my piece and I was blown away. Simply amazing. I'd show you a picture of it, but it's currently in that "peely" stage and I'm not going to let my skin healing mar Ben's reputation. Even in the state that it's in currently, (and also unfinished) I have gotten so many compliments on it. I know when it's completely colored in that I am going to have a piece that I will treasure always. You know because it's on my body permanently, but more importantly because it's fucking amazing. I had the chance to "people watch" the other artists and customers for the 3.5 hours I was in the chair, and all the artists seemed like cool people who would be able to give you a piece you're proud of. I watched one guy, whose name I didn't catch, pretty much freehand the most realistic elephant I have ever seen in my life.  This isn't to say Ben's not much for conversation, but I'm a socially awkward gal and totally suck at small talk, so I chose to spend my time checking out the art that covers the walls and  taking a peek at what other people were getting done. I guess I'm saying, unless you have any skills at running a conversation you're golden, but if you're a shy person like me, maybe it would behoove you to bring a book or something.I ramble. Anyway....check them out. Highly recommended.

37.description: I got my first tattoo done here a week ago. I did my research on tattoo shops in Chicago and from what I seen and heard, this is the place to go. I wasn't disappointed. Everyone was professional and really attentive. The shop was well managed and very pristine. Stephanie White worked on my tattoo and did a awesome job on the line work and blending. As an artist myself, I could tell she had a great eye for detail and really treated the piece as a work of art. This is the standard to which I will judge all other tattoo shops.

0.description: i'm old school in pretty much everything i do and i don't abide pretentiousness or hipster bull shit. since i've not been in a tattoo shop in more than 20 years i was concerned i'd be faced with exactly that. for me it was essential that i have an artist who was committed and had his own thing but who also understood that the old flash deserves as much respect and attention as any new designs do. my artist was ben wahhh. he filled the bill.my sailor jerry pin up girl was getting a little worse for wear and tear as she was done some decades back. ben suggested we refresh her as she would be right next to the new piece and we didn't want her looking tired by comparison. as i was batting around a few ideas for the new one he patiently helped me settle on a just the right classic. he took plenty of time helping me decide on placement and size. it seemed just as important to him as to me... good guy.the shop is big and clean and full of action and good vibes. the staff seemed to like each other and it was a very pleasurable couple of hours. i love my new tat and my refreshed pin up girl is better than new. way better.thanks ben!

38.description: Ben did an amazing job on my tat! The staff is friendly, the facilities are clean and flawless -  I wouldn't go anywhere else.

51.description: Best tattoo shop in Chicago hands down! I met with Ben a couple months ago for a consultation. He shot me straight and was very upfront with what he could and couldn't do. I find this refreshing, most places will always say yes and do what they can to take your cash. My tattoo was unique, Ben had to tattoo over some scar tissue from a long time ago. The design was executed flawlessly, it actually came out way better than I expected! The shop was in great condition and I loved the vibe between all the artist. It was an awesome distraction from the pain of the tattoo. This is the best place in Chicago without a doubt, I recommend everyone go to this shop!

27.description: Stephanie White was my artist. I sent her a rough sketch of what I wanted done and she cleaned it up and spent a lot of time on my idea making it perfect and I couldnt be happier with the final results. She is very nice and professional. I highly recommend this place to get your tattoos.

32.description: Bens done an amazing job of pulling together an A Team of tattoo professionals. The talent in the room was inspiring and my tattoo experience couldn't have been better.  Thanks Ben, see you again when I make it back to Chicago.

54.description: First make an appointment and send ideas of the work you want to the artist ahead of time.Got work done with Stephanie and she was amazing to deal with.  She did a great job on the line work, was awesome on making sure I was ok and at ease for my first tattoo.  I highly recommend Stephanie and I already booked my next appointment.

48.description: I had Jim Little for my first tattoo! And he was superb! He was nice and did a great job on my four inch writing quill tat. I had a nice convo with him during the process too and he was super awesome! Plan on coming back for another in the future :)

44.description: Me my family and my friends have been coming here for years and they do outstanding work.  Ben the owner and my artist always takes care of me and does awesome work.  Wherever I go I always get asked where I get my work done because it is very detailed and stands out.  When you walk in it is very clean and someone will always take care of you.  They also have many great artists as well.

24.description: I went to Stephanie White at Deluxe Tattoo for my first tattoo, a triple arm band around my forearm, and she did an absolutely amazing job! She was very professional and attentive to my requests, helped select the perfect shade of green from about dozen options she had on hand, and provided expert consultation on the thickness of the bands and black outline. She was incredibly patient and precise with the placement, which I very much appreciated because the bands are perfectly straight and even all around. The parlor itself is very clean and has an inclusive feel to it. The artists all seem to get along well, which makes for a nice atmosphere. Very clean, high attention to sanitary practices, and they provide free touch-ups after healing. I highly recommend this place, and Stephanie in particular!

7.description: Dustin is the man! He has done an amazing job on my boyfriends sleeve and we couldn't be more impressed. He's extremely popular, so I suggest you get into him as soon as you can. The parlor itself is very clean and on close inspection, it looks as if everybody here does a good job. We have been in here at least 4 times and I have yet to find someone that is dissatisfied with their art. Also, please keep in mind that you are not allowed behind the counter unless you are being worked on. I personally like this rule as I could see it posing problems as far as proper sterilization and also it alleviates random people walking around, potentially messing up someone's tat.

49.description: Hands down one of the best shops in Chicago. Stephanie White is super talented, friendly and easy going. Love the piece she did on my hand.

40.description: I came here to get my first tattoo last week. I walked in with an idea and walked out with a creation beyond my expectations. Jason Longtin was my artist and I cannot say enough about his work to truly give it justice. He really listened to what I wanted and designed a piece so beautiful. The placement and color of this piece really made my vision come to life. Jason's work speaks for its self and the cleanliness of the place was impeccable. I will go to Jason for any work I want done in the future, no matter where I live. When you go to Jason you are paying for true artistry and quality. Cannot wait for another!!!

53.description: Not a whole lot new to add, but I wanted to give Zach some more love. I went in this last weekend with my brother and sister to get our "sibling tattoo". Though it wasn't anything incredibly unique (feather with 3 birds), Zach took his time making sure it was what we wanted, but also, and this part I appreciated IMMENSELY, made sure we understood how it would look after 5 years. We wanted to add some writing, but to do so he needed to make it much larger than we had originally wanted, since the smaller writing would end up bleeding together after several years. I really appreciated that he made us realize that rather than letting us tattoo ourselves not fully evaluating the implications.I plan to go back and would recommend Deluxe, and Zach, to anyone!

30.description: Jason Vaughn is stellar. His work is perfect. He is a bit quiet but that is good. He works fast and is impeccable with his attention to detail and the colors he chooses.  Unfortunately he is relocating to LA in October. I will have to get in there for another before he leaves.

46.description: My experience at Deluxe was awesome! I got my first tattoo here with Stephanie and she was just wonderful. Really calmed my nerves and tended to all my needs. Not to mention her work alone was worth five stars for sure. The place was clean and smelled like a hospital. Which I guess is what you want from a tattoo shop. Only problem was the music....if you don't like metal bring your own tunes for sure! Otherwise I was superbly happy with my experience here.

1.description: Like others, I had a fantastic experience at Deluxe. I'd been thinking about getting this tattoo for a couple of years. When I decided to pull the trigger I did research and chose Stephanie based on the praise for her script work. Since this was going to be my first tattoo, I didn't even care what Stephanie was like as a person-- just that she delivered on my vision. Turns out, she's friendly, down-to-earth AND a great artist.
