I emailed back-and-forth with her for quite some time and finally chose a date. She was courtious the entire time and super responsive. She even emailed me when she had a cancellation so I could come in early. When the date came I was pretty nervous, even thought about turning around and going home. But once I walked into Deluxe I knew I'd chosen the right place. The studio itself is large, open and has a lot of natural light. In not so many words, it's comfortable. There were quite a few customers already waiting at noon (always a good sign) but even so, I was greeted immediately and never left waiting. My tattoo itself is small and only took about 5-10 minutes to complete. Stephanie took nearly an hour with me though to get the font, placement and overall aesthetic correct. She worked on it until the font was as I'd hoped, then let me bounce back-and-forth between the mirror, the bathroom and my friend. She never acted impatient; on the contrary, she encouraged me to take a multitude of looks at different angles. Once I was committed to placement she got to work. She made conversation almost the whole time and I was super comfortable with her. She even started tattooing for just a few seconds to show me how it would feel (just like a lot of little pinches, as others have said). I smiled ear to ear when I saw the finished product. All said and done, I love what she designed, how she worked and how everyone else in the studio treated me. (Even those waiting for tattoos in the front of the shop were super friendly and offered little tips of advice). I highly, HIGHLY recommend Stephanie and Deluxe, especially for first-timers like me. [Tip: It may take some time to secure an appointment with her, so book ahead if you're serious.]

55.description: I've had seven tattoos here. All by Zach. I drove three and a half hours each way to get them done. There will be more in the near future. I won't go anywhere else. The place is clinically clean. You'll know that came to the right place, immediately.

9.description: Jimmy Little Rocked my 2 new Tattoos.  First of all I would not go anywhere else.  The parlor is very clean, and the staff so nice and easy going.  I felt very comfortable there and informed as it was my first time.  There is talent oozing out from the walls in this place, so you are lucky to get any of these artists.  Jimmy Little was my artist, so patient, supportive and made sure I was 100% satisfied.  He drew my tattoos (Phoenix rising, script) so flawlessly there were no changes at all!  He and I were on the same page.  His free hand script is what blew me away....  feminine, strong, and unique.  He listened to my vision and delivered. Mu husband is excited to now get his!

26.description: Andy did an awesome job and finished up a big crow on my ribs in a little under an hour and a half. He was friendly, professional, and inks fantastic shading and clean lines! Highly recommended.

25.description: Dustin is the man! He has done an amazing job on my boyfriends sleeve and we couldn't be more impressed. He's extremely popular, so I suggest you get into him as soon as you can. The parlor itself is very clean and on close inspection, it looks as if everybody here does a good job. We have been in here at least 4 times and I have yet to find someone that is dissatisfied with their art. Also, please keep in mind that you are not allowed behind the counter unless you are being worked on. I personally like this rule as I could see it posing problems as far as proper sterilization and also it alleviates random people walking around, potentially messing up someone's tat.

12.description: Just got my first tattoo done by Bunny! I brought a rough idea of what I wanted and I said I want it more like this or like that, and Bunny did a sketch with which I was extremely happy and went with it! It's nothing intricate - just four words and a lip imprint - but I LOVE it.  Bunny was very professional, made me feel comfortable (guess he saw the fear in my eyes...) and made sure I was OK through out the process.  As for the price, since this is my first one, I don't have anything to compare to, but I thought $150 plus tip was a fair price for the experience, quality and service.  It helps that Bunny is a long haired, bearded eye candy!Thank you and I'll be back!!!

59.description: Got my second tattoo done here. It was small so it was done quickly and efficiently! I had Ryan, who was really nice and helped ease me nerves. I get nervous about pain, and he assured me that if I needed a break, he wouldn't mind taking one so I could feel better. I didn't need one though! He did a wonderful job with my tattoo. The price was excellent as well. My first tattoo was also small and was worth $80, way more than I thought it would be. But then I came here and got another tattoo of roughly the same size and it was $20 cheaper! The tattoo shop was also very clean, and the rest of the staff were extremely nice. I will definitely be coming back for a touch up (if and when I need them) or any future tattoos I want.

21.description: Just got my first tattoo done by Bunny! I brought a rough idea of what I wanted and I said I want it more like this or like that, and Bunny did a sketch with which I was extremely happy and went with it! It's nothing intricate - just four words and a lip imprint - but I LOVE it.  Bunny was very professional, made me feel comfortable (guess he saw the fear in my eyes...) and made sure I was OK through out the process.  As for the price, since this is my first one, I don't have anything to compare to, but I thought $150 plus tip was a fair price for the experience, quality and service.  It helps that Bunny is a long haired, bearded eye candy!Thank you and I'll be back!!!

17.description: I got my first tattoo done here a week ago. I did my research on tattoo shops in Chicago and from what I seen and heard, this is the place to go. I wasn't disappointed. Everyone was professional and really attentive. The shop was well managed and very pristine. Stephanie White worked on my tattoo and did a awesome job on the line work and blending. As an artist myself, I could tell she had a great eye for detail and really treated the piece as a work of art. This is the standard to which I will judge all other tattoo shops.

10.description: I had two of my tattoos done by Jim Little during Thanksgiving time. He is a talented artist and would actually listen to what tattoo you want then draw them up and give you different versions of it for you to pick. He is very patient and unlike other artists I've encountered, he is trustworthy and won't intimidate you if you are as timid as me. My friends think these two are the best tattoos I have (although I only have 3). Also the front desk's service is very nice and welcoming, and if you are a walk-in like me, the wait is not long at all, besides, it's totally worth it.  I'm definitely going back there.

5.description: Went in on Sunday, 12/20. Had an appointment with Dustin to add a few things to a previous tattoo I already have. Shop was super clean, staff were very nice and attentive, and Dustin is a great artist who knows his way around a tattoo machine. I have zero complaints about this place. I will go back again. Keep in mind they have a minimum of $100 dollars so make sure you are getting your moneys worth. If you're only looking for a small outline of your hamster you may want to go somewhere else. If you want that hamster to look like a badass and take up half your arm this is your place.

3.description: After looking up many places online to get my first tattoo at I chose this one for its great reviews.  They made the entire experience as quick and comforting as possible.  Very clean, friendly helpful staff.  I emailed in 2 designs before hand and when I got there my artist, Bunny, had drawn up a sketch mixing the 2 which I LOVED!!! He gave my sister and I perfect tattoos and we could not be happier.  Would 100% recommend to anyone getting a tattoo.

35.description: My husband and I are long-time clients of Ben Wahhh. Ben is no BS and straight to the point. He will work with you on any design you want, and is willing to try new things (in which he will succeed). But he specializes in biomech so take advantage of that if you can. He works very quickly and efficiently, and isn't heavy-handed like some artists are. His tattoos always heal crisp and quick (providing you don't skimp on the aftercare, but that goes for any tattoo). I have tried other artists here and there but always go back to Ben and will probably do so until I'm old and gray(er).

19.description: Professionally run operation.  I absolutely love my tattoo.  Thanks Troy.  I'll be back.

28.description: Bunny, my tat guy was fantastic. I gave him an idea of what i wanted , and within a week, he drew exactly what i wanted, with great artistic skills. Totally happy with my Bio-mechanical tattoo.  Also, the place is very clean, bright and totally professional.  5 stars, in my book

45.description: I can't even begin to express my displeasure with Deluxe Tattoo. I walked in to have a tattoo done and my friend was already there. We spoke for a quick minute and then I stood at the counter with my ID and drawing out and no one even acknowledged my presence. Not wanting to be a rude person, I waited patiently and still no one approached me for over 20 minutes, even after an artist finished and charged another patron for her tattoo. I then asked an artist if it was too late for a walk in and the guy said probably. He then asked what I wanted and I showed him a series of phrases that were already printed out and ready to be traced and he responded that he had bad handwriting and had been working all day so it was probably too late. Then when I asked to go back with my friend I was told I was not allowed even though I had done it before! I have never been more frustrated with a place of business or felt more passive aggressive rude behavior directed towards me. I will NEVER step foot in that establishment again nor consciously recommend someone get work done there. My first tattoo there was handled by a traveling artist which I suppose  is why my experience was totally positive. You people need a solid lesson in how to treat your customers.

33.description: I rarely write reviews and this one is well deserved. My tattoo artist is Zach his talent is beyond amazing. He took on a very challenging project and promised me that I will be satisfied with the outcome. He has since proven that to be true. Zach's ability with detail and color is incredible and with every session, I am more and more amazed at what he can do. I have been receiving many compliments on my tattoo and honestly it's turning out better than I ever imagined. Besides the quality of his work, Zach is very professional and I feel comfortable with him tattooing me. It's a bonus that he's funny because it makes the process more pleasant. As far as the shop, it is always very clean and the other artists seem cool. Shout-out to Steph for always being so friendly and nice, from what I've seen she also does a great job tattooing. I love that Zach and you work next to each other. Can't wait till my next session.

43.description: Deluxe Tattoo is home to amazing artists. Each artist is talented and does great work.  If you are getting your first tattoo or have many you will like the experience. I had an amazing experience from the first consultation through completing sleeves on both arms. Check out the work of my favorite artist, Jason Longtin.

2.description: I had to update my review and tell the Yelp world that Deluxe Tattoo is stacked with talented artists. When I found out the previous artist I had worked with no longer worked here, I still booked an appointment knowing I'd still get good service. Yes, best friend/matching tattoos are cliched, but no I don't care. My best friend of 10 years and I wanted cupcake tattoos in honor of my moving away. The day before our appointment I got a call that our artists' wife had had a baby so we could either reschedule with him or get someone new. Our new artist Zach stepped in and sketched an awesome looking tattoo. A few hours later we were done, full of pain, and looking awesome. Zach was great with his suggestions and took the time to explain placement from an artistic prospective. There's a reason my boyfriend hangs the art in our house, folks...I'm not one to have the full artsy vision others do. That's why Zach is awesome at what he does and I...am not a tattoo artist. Even though I no longer live in Chicago, I'd still make the trip here to get anything new. Why fix what isn't broken?

18.description: OUTRAGEOUS! ... In the best possible way. I can't even wait to write this review because Troy Taylor was that awesome. I just walked in today to get a tattoo I've been wanting for a while. After just letting Troy know what kind of flower I wanted and an example of a tattoo I saw that I thought was cool he got to drawing. We went thru a couple of drafts before figuring the perfect size for my arm. He was really patient about it though and just wanted to make sure I loved it. That was really encouraging because I didn't want to be annoying. Once we got the right one and he set up everything he asked me to make sure I liked the placement by checking it out in the mirror and directed me to the mirror. It was perfect, so he got to work. I was just amazed at how fast and efficiently he worked without losing any detail or quality. It seriously took him only 45 minutes from the moment he get got going. I am so impressed! Loved the place and experience, especially since I was a walk in and didn't know what to expect. Good job Troy and Deluxe Tattoo!

41.description: Out of all the tattoo shops in Chicago, this one came highly regarded and recommended by several people, among different groups of my friends. Walking into the shop, you will find a clean and sanitary studio with artists abound. They are customer service oriented and ensure that their guests are taken care of from the original consult to after care.My artist is Jason Vaughn. He has an amazing talent in art and tattooing and uses it well, creating exactly what you ask for using vibrant colors and careful precision. He is a very quick tattoo-giver, so you won't be spending extra money due to time. Now...when I get a tattoo, I know that I'm going to have this piece of art on my person for the rest of my life, so I greatly appreciate when my artist says it's time to stop. Additionally, I also understand that as much as I'd love to have my friends and family come back and sit there while needles are piercing my skin applying ink, well, besides being boring, it can be distracting to both me and the artist. In addition to being a health code thing, I appreciate the enforcement at the shop This is not your "run-of-the-mill" tattoo studio. This place is for the person that seriously understands what getting a tattoo means to them.The music playlist can use a bit of a make-over, however...but I tend to bring a pair of headphones and zone out to my own tunes...So, if you're looking for an amazing looking tattoo, you've found the right place - and Jason is your artist.

52.description: This was my fourth tattoo from here. I have one from Ben one from Dustin and two from Zach. There is a reason I've only gone to deluxe, they're amazing at what they do.

50.description: Stephanie White is phenomenal. She spent a lot of time fine tuning the tattoo I wanted. I wanted some words placed alongside of my tattoo I had emailed her in advance and after about an hour (and talking though the placement and the font) she came up with something I was really happy with. Plus, we used my handwriting so it made it even more personal. She was meticulous about the placement of it and making sure it was straight and in a place that later in life I would still like it. I picked her because I liked the way she had varying thickness of lines (different gauges of needles?) and the boldness of the color she used seemed to really pop in the photos she has online.  After sitting with her for 3.5 hours and learning more about what she completely does and how talented she is, she has some great water color tattoos. The bird she has posted is so good and completely different than what she has traditionally done. So, that in my mind is talent.  And, she started the water color tattoos because that's what her client had asked her for so I knew she would do my tattoo exactly the way I wanted. I knew she was fairly new to Deluxe Tattoo because I always check their site to see when Hannah was going to come back but when I saw her work I decided to go with her. I'm glad I did.

4.description: Troy Taylor did a masterful job with my compass shoulder cap. I sent two rough renderings of my ideas through the form on the Deluxe website and within hours, Troy emailed me back personally and said he would be taking on my piece. They have a modern and organized approach to setting up an appointment so when I got there, Troy already had a piece drawn up for me and was very opening to changes or modifications. But he pretty much nailed it on the first try. He was very professional, appropriately quick, super easy to get along with. I will definitely be going back for more ink from him and recommending to anyone and everyone to give him and Deluxe a visit. There's a reason they are so highly rated -- they live up to the reviews! (Also incredibly fairly and appropriately priced.)

6.description: Been tattooed there a number of times - highly recommended.   Outstanding artists,  fun Shop and great management.  I like the whole process and business.

22.description: Super easy. My first tattoo was on the top of my foot (small, solid black). It took about 7 minutes and barely hurt at all. Customer service was good and all of the artists are very friendly. I'll be going back for my next one soon!

15.description: Before there were camera phones, before the iPad, before selfies, before hybrid cars, I won $200 on video poker slots (when they still paid out in change) and got my first tattoo.  Admittedly, it was a tramp stamp.  Admittedly, I did shots of tequila to give me liquid courage.   At that time, I fell for the "tattoos are addicting" and got another set of tattoos next to the first tattoo when I was at a tattoo convention.  I almost passed out in front of thousands of people.Needless to say, I was hesitant to get another because I didn't know what I wanted.   Fast forward 13 years, and I was ready.  I knew what I wanted, mostly on the where, and was recommended to Deluxe by a few people.  I initially had considered a different artist, but Troy was available when I wanted to go.  He was very patient with me while we worked out where it would go, how it was going to look, and what font I wanted to use, and was done within an hour.  I am very happy with my new tattoo and will going back to Troy for my next one.Why one less star?  Because I contacted the other artist via email, and needless to say, the response was a rather curt "just call to set up a consultation."  I think it should be clearer on the website who needs consultations, what their hours are, etc.  Just a thought.

57.description: This place is incredible. Clean, professional, efficient. You get what you pay for - their work is impeccable. I highly recommend jimmy.

20.description: Troy Taylor did a masterful job with my compass shoulder cap. I sent two rough renderings of my ideas through the form on the Deluxe website and within hours, Troy emailed me back personally and said he would be taking on my piece. They have a modern and organized approach to setting up an appointment so when I got there, Troy already had a piece drawn up for me and was very opening to changes or modifications. But he pretty much nailed it on the first try. He was very professional, appropriately quick, super easy to get along with. I will definitely be going back for more ink from him and recommending to anyone and everyone to give him and Deluxe a visit. There's a reason they are so highly rated -- they live up to the reviews! (Also incredibly fairly and appropriately priced.)

36.description: Traveled 2  1/2 hours each way for 3 sessions with Ben.  He was able to transform my different ideas into a tattoo. Super accessible and easy to work with. Great artist.  While getting tattooed, I could see Ryan, Jim Little, Stephanie, and Zach working.  From little to pig pieces, everything was impeccable within the different styles.  Their interactions with the clients were smooth and pleasant judging by the clients' happy faces with the job.  Even though I always had an appointment scheduled, by the minute I stepped in the shop someone was asking if I was already helped.  Loved the music, got myself "headbanging" at times.  Bottom line... Deluxe Tattoo is a welcoming environment with real artists that can put ideas and feelings into tattoos.  Will definitely come back for more.

14.description: Out of all the tattoo shops in Chicago, this one came highly regarded and recommended by several people, among different groups of my friends. Walking into the shop, you will find a clean and sanitary studio with artists abound. They are customer service oriented and ensure that their guests are taken care of from the original consult to after care.My artist is Jason Vaughn. He has an amazing talent in art and tattooing and uses it well, creating exactly what you ask for using vibrant colors and careful precision. He is a very quick tattoo-giver, so you won't be spending extra money due to time. Now...when I get a tattoo, I know that I'm going to have this piece of art on my person for the rest of my life, so I greatly appreciate when my artist says it's time to stop. Additionally, I also understand that as much as I'd love to have my friends and family come back and sit there while needles are piercing my skin applying ink, well, besides being boring, it can be distracting to both me and the artist. In addition to being a health code thing, I appreciate the enforcement at the shop This is not your "run-of-the-mill" tattoo studio. This place is for the person that seriously understands what getting a tattoo means to them.The music playlist can use a bit of a make-over, however...but I tend to bring a pair of headphones and zone out to my own tunes...So, if you're looking for an amazing looking tattoo, you've found the right place - and Jason is your artist.

1.description: There are two body piercers to my knowledge. The man I saw was inexperienced with lip piercings. The room was messy. The set up didn't look good. I sat there wondering why I didn't just get up and leave. He cleaned my face with what he said was witch hazel but I'm not sure. I don't know if he sanitized the clamps or not and I didn't see an autoclave at all. He marked the spot where the piercing would go. He pierced my lip and then took a very long time putting the ball on. He dropped the first ball and then tried to find it. It seemed like I waited forever for him to find it. Once he found it and put the ball on my lip was tender and it hurt. I was so glad to be done with the process I just got up and left. I won't be returning to south side tattoo for anymore services. The place needs a serious upgrade and the piercer I saw needs a lot more training.

0.description: From the moment you are buzzed in you feel welcomed!  I had many questions and the young lady had no problem answering them all!Now, I have been here before for my piercing and they did an excellent job!  Very proffessional and very clean!I mean when you are thinking of a Tat or a piercing you can't just go to anyone!  The Tats are a reasonalbe price and vary on the size, detail and coloring!The piercing I received was only 50 dollars when I received mine!So if you are thinking of a clean, reliable and friendly place to go to get your new Tat or a Tat in general  I would say this is a great place to go!!!If you want to get a piercing I would say the same thing especially since I have gotten 2 from here and I'm glad I did!!!

3.description: I wasn't feeling the decor but the food was decent.  They went for a urban chic look but obviously didn't use top grade materials or furnishing. The place looks like it could use better upkeep but it's not a dump either.I had the ribeye breakfast withe eggs and hash browns with toast. The steak was thin but very well seasoned. The eggs were just okay. They were not fluffy and obviously cook on the same griddle as everything else.The wife had the Creamy caramel pecan waffle. She loved it! Sweet, nutty and crisp waffles with great flavor and texture.

1.description: Terrible service, terrible flavorless food, I wish I could give no stars..we have to stop accepting whatever because it's available. Check out my tip for full rant & review

2.description: The service was really good. The food was great. They have added to their menu. They could extend the hours. I would recommend this place.

9.description: This place is a south side gem. Their waffles melt in your mouth there so good and they dont need syrup. My favorite i sthere Chicken and waffles. However I love there omeletes, salads and skillets. The inside has a very warm welcoming and trendy feel. The customer service and lemonade is also great. if you are ever in the area defly try them.

10.description: I really like this place!The staff is nice and food is great!  I love how they have WIFI and I can get about from my home office to work and or meet clients.Besides Avalon Park is an awesome community and we want to support our local business!  I'm going to start 100 Percent of the time tell clients to meet me here vs StarbucksSupport Local and don't be a hater.  LOLYolandra "Faith" MartinIllinois Real Estate BrokerCell 773-301-1091Voice Mail 773-977-8630Fax 312-962-4937MartinTheBroker@gmail.comView Apartment VIDEOS:  youtube.com/MartinTheBro…*SALES*LEASING*MANAGEMENT*CONSULTING

4.description: I am so glad to have found Stony's Palace Cafe! The cafe is charming and very comfortable. The service was fast and friendly. The food and coffee were delicious!!! I will be returning again soon!

6.description: I love the Jerk chicken tacos an my daughter had the steak tacos they were so delicious.  I can not wait to return back to this restaurant. We found this restaurant  just by going south bound on Stony Island and it was truly the best decision we made.

12.description: I've passed by this more times than i can count. I finally went in.  Decor: it must have been a lounge before or doubles as one because the velvet couches don't seem to say breakfast diner but I liked it.  Service: the two waitresses were very nice. Food: I ordered the ham&cheese breakfast with eggs fried hard with cheese, hash browns & a side of pancakes,  The ham was the best part.   The hash browns were typical &the pancakes were ok. I'll try the waffles next time.

5.description: Came here for Mother's Day Brunch.There was a large group of us and we waited a very long time to get our food. As a group we were not given our food around the same time either. We were all starving so this pissed people off. One person from our group actually refused her potential meal  & left because she ended up being the very last person who did not have her food. This is all after it had been an hour plus since we'd been seated.I ordered a patty melt and I guess I shouldn't have. I figure it's really hard to screw up a patty melt - but the meat tasted old and it made me quite sad. The fries that came with my food were really good though!I was too through when I found that as my infant daughter was chewing her micky mouse pancakes that there was a long hair sticking out of her mouth in her food.... It was evident that the hair did not match anyone at our table, so I had to hold myself back from flipping out. I didn't bother even complaining about it at the time because I don't ever picture myself coming back.Overall service was alright - not spectacular, but nothing to complain too much about in that department aside from our meals not being served at the same time. Menu pricing is decent as well.I give this place 2 stars instead of 1 because some people enjoyed their meals even though it took forever to come out. I was definitely not a camper though.

13.description: I am so rooting for this place to succeed.  The food is good, its pretty resaonable priced, and the undustrial city loft feeling and decor is AWESOME. Now for the BUT.  There is definately room for improvement in the SERVICE.  The first time that we went there, we walked in, and did not know that we were supposed to seat ourselves, and the server/bussers just walked by us. Finally someone acknowledged us and told us to seat ourselves.  The person that brought water to the table did say a word, and the server looked DEPRESSED.  I was like "WHAT A SAD PLACE".  so the other day, i decided to give the place another chance.  This time it was afraid that it was going to be the same experience.  The persoe that brought the water looked SO SAD and didnt say a word to us, and the server was just as SAD, but the food was AWESOME.  So when the server brought the chack and asked how things were, i decided to be honest and told her exactly what I thought, and she definately made an error to make a little conversation and even made a litte joke.  This is definately going to be my go to breakfast spot, but I am so hoping that it is successful.  With such a small and new spot,, If i were the manager/owner, i would definately make the rounds to the table to ask how things are and thank the customers for coming,   Just a thought.

11.description: The place is comfortable, the food is good but the service is slow for the price. I'm sitting here and had to ask the cook to make what I wanted :(

8.description: We've passed this place several times and finally got up early enough for breakfast this Sunday. If you want a waffle, you're okay. If you're hoping for anything else, go elsewhere. The turkey sausage was...I really don't know how else to describe it but wet and squishy. Although I ordered pork bacon, I'm pretty sure the pile of scraps that served as "four strips of bacon" was actually turkey bacon, deep fried and overcooked.  The inside is pretty dimly lit, but it appeared they had some patio seating out back, but it was too cold for that. Might be good for a hangover, but I don't feel like we'll be going back. I feel like I'm possibly being over critical, but I think I just had my hopes up for a good soul food breakfast, and it just didn't happen.

0.description: Great food and they are now doing party rentals. I  look forward to having my next event here.

7.description: I've been here about 3-4 times. The very first time it was for Mother's Day and it was a group of us. My mom and I had a dirty fork so they went to go get clean ones. Then they toke forever to give us all our food since it was a large group. The second visit me and my sister went in cause we just wanted pancakes and eggs. So we ordered, sat at the table to wait and get our food, we sit and the table is stuck all over. I'm like what?!?!?! It was so gross. So we went to another table and that one was sticky too. I couldn't believe it. The third time we kept having to repeat our order and they messed up my order. Then for the drinks this guy I don't know if he was deaf but we had to point to what drink we want. They need someone to do the orders that you don't have to worry about doing that. I'm not going back there. I love the food but it's not worth it

0.description: We normally order a ham for every holiday well our thanksgiving ham didn't have any honey glaze on it... So we take ham back and they put some on it... Nope won't get no more of our business... Pay too much for a Honey Baked ham to be treated like this... I will tell everyone near and far go to the other honey baked. This is the first and last time you mistreat my family... No more support we will spend our money elsewhere!

12.description: Great food, great service! I now know why they call it a gym shoe.

7.description: Love that they are open 24 hours!! They take cash only and they are newly remodeled!!! The Italian beef sandwiches are so good and a huge portion! They come with fries and a drink as well. Another good thing is that they have mild sauce and they aren't stingy with it like most places !!!

3.description: I have seen this place for years but I never thought about walking in and taking a look at their menu because it just seemed like a hole in the wall...so why bother!!!Well boy o boy I was wrong...you know the saying don't judge a book by its cover, well I should have listened.The place was clean and had a pleasant smell in the air and that doesn't happen often when you go into some of these greasy spoons.This is also a CASH ONLY restaurant so leave your credit and debit cards at home because your plastic won't work there.They are open 24 hours a day and had a steady of people coming into the restaurant but they still seem to keep up with the orders...That's a plus in my mind!They had a variety of Choices from Breakfast to Dinner and everything in between.Breakfast is served 6am to 6pm at very low prices.  I don't know to many places where you can get an omelet for under 6 dollars and it still comes with hash browns.  I will most definitely come back and try it out!The young lady behind the counter that took the order was smiling the entire time...another Plus in my book.I had the Jim Shoe sandwich which is jammed packed with meat(gyro, Italian beef and corn beef) it also had lettuce, tomatoes, onions, hot peppers, sweet peppers, mayo and gyro sauce and cheese.  Yes it is a heart attract on a bun but I enjoyed every bite and it's not like I am going to eat it everyday...lol It was a moment of splurging!!!  The price was pretty reasonable as well...I want to say about $7.81 and it came with fries and a pop!!!  I have to say too that I loved the mild sauce on my fries it didn't have that funny after taste that some places have when you get the mild sauce.This place is a hidden gem that I was looking at for years but never took the time to explore...Everything was fresh and truly changed what I use to think of this place.  If my next visit is as good as this one...They will have a loyal customer for life.So if you are in that neck of the woods and you don't want to break your budget on buying something to eat and you want something good and fresh you have to stop at Stony Sub...I don't think you will be disappointed...I know I wasn't!!!Enjoy!!!

1.description: After having a conversation with a coworker about the Jim shoe and what it is and how it's made, and it's origins I decided to try it. And why not go to the place where everyone says it's best. So even though I don't live anywhere near this particular restaurant I took the journey here to try this sandwich I hear so much about. And I made an excellent choice. Upon entering this restaurant I'm greeted by a friendly woman, who took the time to actually talk a bit with me before taking my order. And never got irritated at my many questions, which I had quite a few. She even gave suggestions on what is good as well as what not to bother with. Which I think was refreshing because most times they just ring you up for whatever you ask for, knowing once you receive it you won't be satisfied.After a short wait she let me know my order was ready.  I took my order and left, eating my fries as I traveled to my destination. I consider myself a french fries conosuer, and these did not disappoint. And as one other reviewer stated their mild sauce tasted just right. Once I reached my location I opened my sandwich ready to take a bite, let me tell you this sandwich I very large, and they don't skimp on the meat either. It comes with roast beef, gyro meat, and corned beef, topped with  lettuce, tomatoes, sweet and hot peppers, mayo,  tzaziki sauce, and cheese. I skipped the mayo and sweet peppers, and got everything else. I am not sure who thought to put this combination of meats together, nor why they work so well together. But I am glad that I did try, if your wondering if you should try it, I say go for it.

2.description: There's only one real reason to come to Stony Sub, and that's the Jim Shoe Sandwich. I, too, had heard whispering of this audacious sandwich, which dared to challenge the limitations of Chicago sandwichness as we know it.  But sadly, for too long I wimped out; always saying it was "too far" or the merit of such a trip being "too unknown."  Well friends. I am proud to state that I DID make that triumphant march to Stony Sub, and yes: the legends that have spake the name JIM SHOE are true! The sandwich is a meat-lovers dream, with enough giardinera peppers to satisfy heat seekers and gives each bite a satisfactory crunch.  The bread--I'm guessing a Turano italian?--is good in that it helps soak up the juices but doesn't fight the flavor of your meat party.  TIPS: there is no parking here, so you have to do street. Also, at night you have some guys trying to sell bootleg DVDs--pay them no mind and don't let them keep you from enjoying your Chicago legendary sub. OH! And you're going to want to do takeout here, as there just a couple of chairs and no tables.

9.description: The 'gym shoe' sandwich is quite possibly the best sub I've ever had. The sweet peppers and mayo add a tangy surprise to this heavyweight, meat-filled delight. The 12 Incher can easily feed a family of 4 for a month (added for effect), The place itself is a tiny yellow shack with the cashier behind what looks like bullet resistant glass. But since I've been taught not to judge a book by its Amazon reviews, I decided to jump in anyway, and needless to say, I was pleasantly surprised. 5 stars for this institution.

10.description: The gym shoe is the bomb..and service is great..always get great food here..always i just got my whole family gym shoes today..we all enjoyed the hot tasty and delicious food..thx stony sub..

13.description: Stopped in to get an Italian beef. The meat was nice and tender and the service was quick. I thought the prices were a little bit on the high side,  but I guess thats because they are open 24 hours. The mild sauce was nice and tangy. I recommend you check it out.

16.description: I have been coming here for years but stopped when the gyro meat fell off hard. it took a girl from hs to post their super steak taco on Instagram. It looked so good I had to get one. I was not disappointed. I also had to try the gym shoe/Jim shoe (corned beef, gyro meat, roast beef, hot & mild peppers, cheese, tomato) it was good too. Mild sauce on the fries. Open 24 hours. If you don't want to wait...phone first. Cash only..fyi

17.description: Good food. You gotta love true Southside grease from time to time.They got it all, from breakfast to midnight munchies

15.description: Great in the hood spot. Been eating here since the early 90s. The Italian beef has went down. The gyro is alright. But the Philly steak is a banger. A lot of people like the gym shoe, it not for me. That's too much going on for one sandwich for me. Like the gyro burger. Either I'm gonna get a gyro or a burger...they also give you fries and pop with most meals. The mild sauce is good, considering I don't like mild sauce.

0.description: I've been coming to stony sub for many years. I was around when they had a location on 87th. I love everything about their establishment except they don't take credit cards...but I understand. The food is ALWAYS where it should be. Jim shoe, chicken wings and tacos....my top favs.

5.description: Not for the faint of heart. The meat options are par-for-the-course but the team at Stony Sub has taken hot sandwiches to the next frontier. I am of course referring to the enigmatic gym-shoe. I rode my bike 17 miles, in the rain, just to eat this mythical meat-pile. Also know there wasn't a good place to really lock up my bike. But now to the sandwich. The legends are true, folks. My flavor buds exploded in exaltation within the first bite. The flavors swim together rhythmically like Louis Armstrong headed into a crescendo. I ate the entire king size sandwich. That's right, will you accept that challenge?Also, I want to mention that everyone in he restaurant was friendly and eager to chat about Southside attractions. Be prepared to make a mess eating your gym-shoe because there are no tables at Stony's.Also, they offer an array of fry flavoring which I haven't seen done before, so kudos for going the extra mile, Stony's.

11.description: Get the gym shoe, thats all I can say. Make sure you just get a regular though, if you have a big appetite, get the king. I feel like now that I know about this south side gem, soon everyone will and they will be coming in mass droves all of a sudden. Really great. Very greasy. Plan to feel great after. I never went in the place, but we got some gym shoes to go, amazing.

8.description: Best hood stop out south, hands down! Service on point always. Food on point, always! My fiance and I have been going here for about 5 years now and love it, especially when we want some shoestring fries with mild sauce, salt and pepper on them. The woman who takes the orders always remembers our order and other returning customers, hell the cooks do too. Its just a quality hood joint! Open 24 with breakfast til 6pm!!!!!!!!!

4.description: OK...I went to Stony Sub.. The service was quite good. The young lady was kind & helpful. Let me first say that I was raised in Philly. The Gym/Jim Shoe is only a Steak Hoagie with Sweet Peppers. That's what I had...with Fries It was "A'ight" I've had better. Honestly, I enjoyed my steaks at Montis', AND Phillys BEST much more. I had a Pop/Soda.. Not much to report, just a good sandwich with above average. I had a "Gyro" Puff as well. It's a Pizza puff with Gyro meat, as a filling. It was also "A'ight". I was disappointed because it was my first time trying this. I've had a Pizza puff B4. So the food was OK.. The service was "above" average. That's my honest critique.

14.description: This place has so much to choose from ! It's so good jus call your order in a head of time

6.description: Jim/Gym Shoe is the best! I love tzatziki (white cucumber gyro) sauce, so I always pay for extra on the side. I also add feta cheese once I get it home (they do not have any). It sets the sandwich off the chain for me!

0.description: Reasonable price for colonics and very educated staff.

1.description: I'm only giving a 1 because I couldn't tap and none were shaved in. Today is Sunday 11-29-2015, my morning started off well, I was able to schedule my daughter Dj for a hair appointment today which is a day the Salon Oury isn't open. So I dropped her off at 12:30 today on 81st Stony Island for hair appointment. I saw a Beggars pizza shop a few stores down, so I decided to walk in. The young lady said hello, and I asked did they have slices. She replied yes, so I ordered a thin sausage and a thin pepperoni, and she asked for a name with the order, I said Carmah'. I got 2 slices in 2 separate boxes and a plastic bag. I love love hot food and to say the least Pizza is my favorite food, so I took a bite in the car as I was driving, and I took a 2nd bite, that's when something stuck me in my tongue, it was so hard my tongue started to bleed, then I spit it out in my hand. I was chewing on Packing Staples, it was at least 5 that landed in my hand. So I placed the pizza and the staples in a napkin. I drove back to Beggars on 81st and Stony Island, told the front cashier what happened and I asked for a manager, she called Demetrius and he came up and said I can give you another slice. I said no thank you I would just like my money back & what if that slice has staples in it, so you'll just keep giving me another slice Mr? Demetrius the acting manager on duty said, it says it on the receipt that we don't do refunds. I asked is it policy that if a customer has something in their food like staples or hair you tell them you don't do refunds? I reply who's over you? Demetrius said I'm the only one here with an attitude, acting like he was deaf, asking me the same thing (what you say, what you say?) I said I'm sure they have phones (& you can call them), I have to come back later so I can leave my number on the receipt for you to call me. I'am very upset that you wouldn't give me back my money when your company is at fault and my damn tongue is bleeding. He walked out of my sight, and a young guy walks in and ask for change for a $20, the young lady cashier said I can't give you change and then Demetrius said hold on I got you. Wait wait wait, I'm a customer with an issue that your policy will push to the side, but you can assists a non paying customer with change. Are you serious demetrius? I said excuse me I want my money back now, he said ok here is your $7 and some odd change (he kinda threw it at me). I have never been to an establishment and felt this way. I honestly can't believe that I was eating packing staples in a slice of Beggars Pizza and the manager refused to issue me a refund for one of the cooks baking a sausage pizza with packing staples. I'm not certain if I even ate them as when I noticed the staples it was my second bite. I would NEVER ORDER ANYTHING FROM THIS BUSINESS. If you ask me Demetrius needs to be fired for his lack of professionalism and disrespect of a customers issued caused by the business. They also need better policies!!! ZERO STARS FOR BEGGARS ON 81st Stony Island

9.description: Terrible. Just terrible. The service is bad, pizza isn't that good, and didn't even give me my military discount. I'd advise you not to go there.

23.description: I have been to this location several times it might be behind plexiglass but the pizza isn't lacking!! I wish they had football pizzas!

5.description: I live in the area, and instead of traveling 4 blocks to come here for pizza I would rather drive 6 miles. THE SERVICE IS THAT BAD! They will ruin your order or just not make it at all. They have bunch of disrespectful teenagers working behind the counter who have on almost every occasion screwed up my order, then are reluctant to refund your money.Don't waste your time, go to another Beggars.

25.description: I don't know why everyone is hating on this location. I've been a constant customer since they opened and really havent had any issues with my pizza. I do agree that the prices seem higher than the other chains, but other than that no complaints. I love beggars pizza and I think they have one of the best tasting pizzas in the city, besides giordanos. Now the Richton park location is the only place that serves garbage, that pizza is horrible, i've went there once and haven't been back.

12.description: The girls working here have real nasty ass attitudes. They were closing early to go to an event at the Shrine that weekend but yet there was no signs put up nor did they tell my brother-in-law we he called and ordered. They also should have had a special message on their phone as well and shouldn't have taken orders after a certain time to ensure they leave on time.When we pulled up, I could see the girl behind the counter had a nasy attitdde, we showed up 10 minutes before they were closing early and they kknew we were coming. My sister wnet up to the door to go in and pay and the door was locked, so the girl behind the counter started talkiing to my sistter between the door, finally my sister said she couldn't here the girl and sshe would have to open the door up. She told my sister she couldn't open tthe door and that security would have to do it, WTF?!?!?!? So the security guy came and unlocked the door, not with a key but by turnign the lock on thhe door, something that girl could have done herself. (And wait, what kindd of pizza place has a damn security person?) Definetly will not be back, ghetto ghetto ghetto, and a hot ass mess.

21.description: I have never had a bad experience here. The girls are always nice to me and cracking jokes every time I come there to pick up my food. Expect a 30+ min wait for your pizza, I always call ahead. They accept coupons and the food is never below amazing. The complaints about yelling thru plexiglass are unecessary because 1) they have an intercom system and 2) if you lived over there, you would understand why. Keep up the good work Stony!

16.description: Great pizza but overly priced. I have picked up from this location just once and I have no complaints. Even though the cashier, who was nice and respectful, was about two inches from sagging his pants from his knees.

17.description: Call it petty, but if I spend $40 on a pizza its crazy that I can only have 2 bags of parmesan. I'm big on customer service, and I hate that in black neighborhoods there are stupid rules like this. I can get 2 for one slice in other areas. There are 100s of pizza places, little things separate them from each other... learn what's good business.

10.description: This has got to be my favorite  Pizza place in Chicago. I'm not a real big deep dish fan so I get the thin crust with pepperoni, and Italian sausage, and when they say they laying on thick they mean it! This pizza is like a delicious cheesy slice of heaven. I can't really speak on the service cause I always call mine end but it's all ready hot and ready when I get there!I've also tried their taco pizza it's a bit messy but I enjoyed it as well!

11.description: This place has the worst customer service ever !!!!!! Literally every time I say I'm going to give them another chance they disappoint me. The people who answer the phone are absolutely horrible and rude. And when I was 9 months preggo the delivery guy wouldn't even bring my pizza to my door. I love the pizza from the beggars franchise but this is by far the worst location ever !

26.description: If you wanna have a heart-attack while scarfing down your second piece then this is the pizza for you.  I think the amount of cheese at least weighed 1 1/2 pounds. I had a small BBQ combo pizza. Sausage, grilled chicken breast,pepperoni, mozzarella and cheddar cheese, red onions and BBQ sauce. This pizza will kill you for sure.  I would like to know which corporate nit-wit said it was ok to mix mozzarella and cheddar cheese on pizza. After opening the box and seeing this monstrosity I was completely turned off after seeing how much cheese was dumped on this pizza.  And when I say dumped I mean by the truck load. Just a big glob.  This is a prime example of how Americans take something simple and bastardize it. Fred Sanford would definetly be going to see Elizabeth if he had a slice of this pizza.  SMDH!!!

22.description: The girls working here have real nasty ass attitudes. They were closing early to go to an event at the Shrine that weekend but yet there was no signs put up nor did they tell my brother-in-law we he called and ordered. They also should have had a special message on their phone as well and shouldn't have taken orders after a certain time to ensure they leave on time.When we pulled up, I could see the girl behind the counter had a nasy attitdde, we showed up 10 minutes before they were closing early and they kknew we were coming. My sister wnet up to the door to go in and pay and the door was locked, so the girl behind the counter started talkiing to my sistter between the door, finally my sister said she couldn't here the girl and sshe would have to open the door up. She told my sister she couldn't open tthe door and that security would have to do it, WTF?!?!?!? So the security guy came and unlocked the door, not with a key but by turnign the lock on thhe door, something that girl could have done herself. (And wait, what kindd of pizza place has a damn security person?) Definetly will not be back, ghetto ghetto ghetto, and a hot ass mess.

0.description: From the time I called in the order until the moment I walked out of the store with my pizza took almost an hour. In today's world that seemed a little long to me, however the pizza was still hot after a 14 minute drive and delicious! I will admit my expectations were low due to previous visits to this location but this visit was much better!!! The Beggar's franchise is known for stacking on the ingredients and this location got it right today, hopefully they continue the tradition.

20.description: I ordered 2 slices of cheese pizza, and got 2 slices of sausage. What else should I say in this review? I think I'm done. If you want Beggars Pizza, go to the north-side Chicago locations. This isn't the 1st time an order has been botched, and they're consistently understaffed and underwhelmed.

19.description: Quick delivery!! Told me it would be an hour and the delivery driver was here in about 40 mins. It was great!

2.description: The service is terrible,they don't have the same menu as other beggars, I stay right down street and I go to Blue Island location very courteous and they give more than one pack of Parmesan&peppers and you can play the lottery to ! Stop telling you're  friends to write good reviews

18.description: Where is the customer service at the Stony Island location?  Surely, your customer database stores the types of pizza your customers order.  And when a customer places an order by phone, don't you confirm it?So why did a relative of mine get an incorrect pizza order and was then told by the cashier, "I don't make wrong orders"?  I didn't know we lived in a perfect world.  Take ownership of your mistake next time.

13.description: Waaaayyyyy too expensive. $66.94 for 3 pizzas. Pizzas weren't even that tasty. For these prices I better be knocked off my feet impressed. I will not be returning.

4.description: they do not lay it thick anymore pizza were very thin. i spoke with lady name shon who were very rude.she told me we don't give refunds, so i suggest  you throw the pizza away... why would i throw.mu money away 20 dollars on a medium nasty pizza.i will never go back  to this beggars  on stony island ever  again if zero stars were an option i'll give them a negative 5 stars.terrible pizza and customers  service  equals no business  from me

24.description: Went there for the first time last night.  I called in an order. The young lady that took my order was VERY pleasant and helpful in helping us decide what to order. We decided on a large stuffed turkey sausage and chicken pizza and 4 wings. $30!!!! After eating my first slice, I wanted to go back and demand at least $20 back. It was not good at all. The chicken tasted old and the pizza just wasn't seasoned at all. I had another piece for lunch today, and I still feel the same.  I know how important it is to patronize businesses in our neighborhood, but unfortunately  I don't think that I will be going back.  I really LOVE Margaritas Pizza, but I refuse to put up with a rude person taking my order. I guess the search is back on for good pizza in South Shore.

6.description: Its a store front space with a sign on the door that says "No Eating In The Lobby"....which is understandable cause the lobby space only has enough room for a bench that customers use to wait for their orders to come up.Aside from that, the slices are delicious!!!! I get two if them and a can of pop, and then leave. There's is a lot of sausage,  the cheese is thick and the sauce is decent if not flavorful. The biggest downside maybe that the parking is smaller than the lobby space.

15.description: This place is the absolute worse pizza establishment on the south side of Chicago. The staff is very rude and unprofessional. I placed an order for a pizza over the phone, when I arrived the illiterate staff couldn't find my pizza. I asked them did the pizza grow legs and walk out. Goodness!!! The manager Shawn Ross refused to apologize about the incident and expected me to wait an additional 30-45 minutes, so they can prepare a new one. Absolutely unacceptable!!!!

7.description: Not too sure why other reviewers have had so many issues at this location. I've ordered from here at least 4 or 5 times and they've been incredibly consistent as far as the food and customer service are concerned. I have never experienced any nasty attitudes. And the people complaining about how much cheese is on the pizza are stupid. Their slogan is "We Lay It on Thick!" and they definitely do.

8.description: I placed an order and when I arrived to pick it up, they have no record of the order being placed.  They said I had to wait an 35 minutes which is addition to the 45 minutes from when I originally placed the order.  I asked did I have to pay full price and they said YES.  I just said that's ok and left.  They don't have to concern themselves with my patronage anymore.

3.description: I purchased two slices of pizza from beggars pizza @ 8100 S. Stony Island unitB on 4/13/2015 @ 248pm. As I. Began eating my slice I noticed a bright green hard piece of something next to my sausage which resembled either rodent poison or rodent dropping. I immediately called the restaurant and they advised me to bring it in. I brought it back @ about 315pm same day as i was already driving to my destination. I had to go out of my way to bring it back. The owner took one look and said it was the sausage. He showed no remorse or regard to my complaint as if he didn't want to deal with me. I tried to explain to him sausage is not green and his employee agreed with me. He walked off before offering an apology and listening to me. His only offer (which he informed the employee and not me before walking off) was another piece of pizza which I did not want as that piece may also be contaminated. I had to have the employee call him back to talk with me. He was very rude and wouldn't refund my money because they have a no refund policy. In a case like this you would think he would for one slice of pizza. He disregarded my complaint and walked off as I was talking to him. There needs to be an immediate inspection as this is a serious health precaution. I will never eat from this place again.

14.description: I catered lunch for my crew today in Hyde Park.  Although, I'm a lifetime fan of Beggars pizza none of my crew had the pleasure and was obviously skeptical.  Not only did the owner deliver himself, just to meet a new customer, the crew was floored by how good the food was.  Compared to catering from some Hyde Park eateries, this Beggars prices are a steal.

0.description: The owner (Aldo Brown) has been my barber since I was in high school... And for good reason. The shop boasts ONLY licensed barbers and a great atmosphere with free wifi and plasma TVs.

1.description: I'm a Cali girl and came to Chicago to visit my in laws. My man swears by his hoagies and I thought what the hell, let's give it a shot! Now I've had my fair share of sandwiches and when he ordered it with extra cheese and extra oil I thought, this can't be good... MAN, WAS I WRONG! I got a few looks standing in line, and it was a long line, BUT based on food alone, this was the best cold cut sandwich I have EVER had! We are here a few more days and not only will we be back, we will definitely be taking some back home!!!! AMAZING!!

9.description: **Update** I drove past Taurus Saturday and there was a crowd of people inside! It looks like they are up and running again. (Does anyone know the reason for the downtime?)

29.description: This is one of those "hidden treasures" of the south side!  Being raised in Michigan (which really doesn't have a "foodie" reputation to begin with), I was woo'ed by MANY foods when I moved here to Chicago back in 1997! This was from pizza to asian food, Greek food, to simple spots like J&J Fish!  I thought I had a "hoagie" when I tried Mr. Submarine's sandwiches...and, for the most part, I was pretty close to the ultimate.  However, it wasn't until 2005 when a dear friend of mine offered to bring me lunch at work that I was knocked OFF MY FEET by what was a white turkey breast hoagie from Taurus Flavors!  Being that I was raised not eating pork, I was beyond impressed that this place served absolutely NO PORK in their restaurant...only turkey and beef products!  I'm thinking "WHAT? A spot in Chicago that DOESN'T SERVE PORK AT ALL?? NO WAY!"  LOLAnyway, I have tried the steak hoagies and the turkey and both are FABULOUS!! Best hoagies I have ever tasted in my life!The service is strictly professional. No joking around or jive talk from the staff. And my orders have never been given to me with any errors. I currently reside in Naperville and every now and again, I will drive an hour all the way over to grab a few sandwiches to take back to the burbs (and pick up a few extras for my friends nearby) if I get a craving!This place is definitely worthy of way more than 5 stars... They deserve 20!FYI: THIS PLACE DOES NOT ACCEPT DEBIT/CREDIT CARD! CASH ONLY!

23.description: They need to step their game back up!  The food is not what it use to be.  You maybe fooled by the crowd outside.  Some are there to order food, the others are there to sell stuff outside the restaurant.  No, I don't want a dvd, I can go to RedBox!  Anyway, they never have white turkey meat, then take it off your menu!  They need a restaurant make over from top to bottom!

5.description: I was a fan of Charlie's Blade and Spade steak sandwich back in the day. I would drive clear across town to get one. I've seen reference that Taurus steak sandwich tastes like Charlie's. Well it did not. Taurus steak sandwich was wet where it should have been dry and dry where it should have been wet. They try to capture Charlie's Blade steak flavor but fall short.  My stomach rumbled for hours and I didn't eat the whole thing.  I ate the bread because the meat was too stringy with strands of fat or ligaments.The beef was dry. I thought it would be saucy but it wasn't. There were chunks of neon green bell pepper that was sweet, I didn't eat that because the color threw me off.  The sandwich was more like a philly cheese steak but not as good and with sweet toppings. Also I kept chewing on something dry like paper, I couldn't tell it it was onion, meat or paper.   I guess my review is jaded because if you tasted Charlie's Blade and Spade you'd know what I mean.I won't go back because it's out of my way and I keep seeking that old Charlie's taste. Service was fast and their was a steady line. It's a carry out, small aged little shack on Stoney Island (a busy street), so it's a safe location.   They sale hoagies but I only eat Fontanos deli subs. My rating is 1out of 5.

31.description: THIS...  Is a Special Review for a place I have LOVED since before the internet and Long before I knew what a review was.  If I could: I would give this place 11 stars.  Every Other word would be BOLD.  Every third phrase would flash.  There Would be an embedded audio track of my own creation SINGING the praises of this place.  As tacky as I think all of those things are, and as much as I Hate to see them... If allowed, I would Not be able to stop myself.  Thank you Yelp for your forced moderation.  No, REALLY.... Thank You.Long story shortened, I have LOVED this place for 25+ years.  I choose no to be more specific.  Although over that period I have probably had everything on their menu, there is only one thing I do or even Need to remember.  @}------- ** The Supreme Steak ** -------{@Yes.  It gets it's own line, with roses & padding.  You didn't see it, but I just added more.I have lived in or near Chicago, New Orleans, Boston, Dallas, San Francisco, San Jose, Los Angeles, New York and visited Egypt, Beijing, Shanghai, South Korea, Italy, France, Puerto Rico and many other places that aren't jumping out at the moment but I have never had Anything that has moved me and stayed with me like a Taurus Flavors Supreme Steak.Think about that one thing in your life that you've eaten and there's NOTHING else that can take it's place.  You can go YEARS without it, forget you even ever had it, but the moment you're in it's vicinity, you're going to have it again, because its a fact of life like the rising and setting sun.  That is what the Taurus Flavors Supreme Steak for me.It's probably a really good thing I don't have regular access to them.  This probably shouldn't even be considered a review.  I have NO IDEA what the service is like.  I don't care.  I don't remember what the rest of the menu is like.  I don't care.  Calories? Cholesterol?  Fat? Sodium?  Price Range... I think it's cheap... I Don't CARE!  Go get a Supreme Steak.  Put it in your Mouth, and Thank Me Later.

25.description: I ditto everyone here that have written paragraphs about the hoagies and steak.  You wanna man to like you, dress sexy.  You want him to marry you, bring him a Taurus.  I moved to the burbs and I hate that I can't have my drug of choice when I get that itch, (nawww..mean)  But maybe that's a good thing.  When I do come to the city, thats where you'll find me bringing back 10 at a time.  All for me!!!! well actually I got my boyfriend from NY hooked on them as well.  Taurus,Please dont ever change and get some locations in the NW surburbs.  I know white ppl will love them as much as black folks

12.description: There's nothing like a Chicago style hoagie or cheese steak!  I grew up on the south side and Taurus was a must for me.  I have been eating Chicago hoagies since I was a child.  I remember when dollar Wednesdays really meant the small hoagie was only a $1.  There is something about the mix of seasoning, oils, meat, rolls and veggies that no other hoagie shop in the city of Chicago or Philly can match. After going to Philadelphia recently and trying their "famous" cheese steak sandwiches I was not impressed at all, especially since they use cheese whiz on their sandwiches.   The steak in Philly was not cooked like a Taurus steak, which is finely chopped and full of season.  Hands down, Chicago Taurus Flavors has the best hoagies and cheese steaks in town.Every time I visit home I have to get a hoagie and steak sandwich from Taurus.  Wish I could ride down Stony Island and pick one up a couple of sandwiches right now.

21.description: The biggest decision of the work day where are we going to eat. Since we were out on the southside we decided to eat somewhere that some of my co workers knew so we ended up here. Its a little white hutch with the founder family and noted Chicago. I got the steak supreme regular $3.50 and it was just okay. I feel like this was stumbled upon one day when the owner had steak some rolls and decided to.do his own spin on a philly/beef sandwich. To me its too sweet maybe add some hot giardinara and the sandwich becomes better. I like to try the Turkey cause after I order 6 people orderd it so I'll give them another chance if I'm out Southeast.

16.description: THIS...  Is a Special Review for a place I have LOVED since before the internet and Long before I knew what a review was.  If I could: I would give this place 11 stars.  Every Other word would be BOLD.  Every third phrase would flash.  There Would be an embedded audio track of my own creation SINGING the praises of this place.  As tacky as I think all of those things are, and as much as I Hate to see them... If allowed, I would Not be able to stop myself.  Thank you Yelp for your forced moderation.  No, REALLY.... Thank You.Long story shortened, I have LOVED this place for 25+ years.  I choose no to be more specific.  Although over that period I have probably had everything on their menu, there is only one thing I do or even Need to remember.  @}------- ** The Supreme Steak ** -------{@Yes.  It gets it's own line, with roses & padding.  You didn't see it, but I just added more.I have lived in or near Chicago, New Orleans, Boston, Dallas, San Francisco, San Jose, Los Angeles, New York and visited Egypt, Beijing, Shanghai, South Korea, Italy, France, Puerto Rico and many other places that aren't jumping out at the moment but I have never had Anything that has moved me and stayed with me like a Taurus Flavors Supreme Steak.Think about that one thing in your life that you've eaten and there's NOTHING else that can take it's place.  You can go YEARS without it, forget you even ever had it, but the moment you're in it's vicinity, you're going to have it again, because its a fact of life like the rising and setting sun.  That is what the Taurus Flavors Supreme Steak for me.It's probably a really good thing I don't have regular access to them.  This probably shouldn't even be considered a review.  I have NO IDEA what the service is like.  I don't care.  I don't remember what the rest of the menu is like.  I don't care.  Calories? Cholesterol?  Fat? Sodium?  Price Range... I think it's cheap... I Don't CARE!  Go get a Supreme Steak.  Put it in your Mouth, and Thank Me Later.

17.description: Quick service. Steak sandwich is not as good as Home of the Hoagy. No fries! Sauce and seasonings on steak sandwich make the difference. They get the extra star for convenience.

10.description: Pretty good food except yesterday they put seasoning on my hoagie when I didn't ask for it they need to learn how to listen to orders. But other than that their food is great.

11.description: After a decade of refusing to try their subs (I'm not a sandwich girl but one of my favorite people swears by them), I finally got tired of saying no to him & gave in. I believe the sandwich I had was a signature turkey sub of sort and I did actually enjoy it. Nothing spectacular & I'm still not a sandwich girl BUT I will likely patron Taurus every now & then. I'm sure my son will be obsessed with them once he's old enough. It's in his genes. If you love subs, Taurus will make you happy.

26.description: I have never tasted better hoagies. I just love the South Side with its many hidden gems. The place does not look like much and slightly dark looking from the outside but, its always packed. Its my personal heaven when I want something with overall goodness. Although, you would put on major pounds eating them constantly.I usually go on a Wednesday or Friday. Wednesday they have specials on the steak hoagy and the small hoagy. I mean you cannot beat $2.75 for a hoagy, pop, and chips or $3.75 for a steak combo. Now, I must introduce you to "The way of the hoagy". It is a certain way that you should enjoy this little peace of deliciousness, It starts by finding a old shirt that you care nothing about. Then, you unwrap the sandwich slowly. It is now time to enjoy, bite into the sandwich vertically. Hoagy juice will get all over the shirt. It is the sign that you did these steps successfully. P.S. Strictly Cash Only!

27.description: I'm a fan. There are reasons why places stick around for over 40 years: loyal customer base, quality product, consistency. I can't speak for factors 1 or 3, but 2 impressed me and I can see why people flock from all over to get their mitts on one of these hoagies.They're delicious. Simply put. But, before I get to that, understand that there's a process to enjoying the sandwich. First, park behind the building. You might be tempted to park on the street. Don't. Stony Island is busy and crowded. If you attempt to park your vehicle while folks are flying past at 70 mph, there will be words. You will not want to hear them. Park in back. Then, once you've parked, walk inside, bypass the dude with the karate kid breath (cuz it was KICKIN'!) trying to sell bootleg DVDs, walk to the right side of the counter (as you're facing it), peruse your selection, step up, order, step back. While the folks behind the counter won't soup nazi your n00b azz, the folks waiting for their food will. Again, 40+ years. Don't screw the system. Once you've ordered (make sure you get chips and some sort of HFCS fruity soda; I chose grape), step up, pay (CASH ONLY) and get out. There's no seating, so come with a plan as to where you're going to dine. Got it? Good.Now, for the sandwich. Excuse me, the hoagie. I loved the fact that I didn't have to ask for a turkey sandwich and be looked at strangely. In the home of Italian Beef and steakhouses galore, not being a beef eater is, sometimes, a weighty label to bear. Here, you can get your turkey on without so much as a side-eye. I got the Regular (regular-sized/medium). It came packed with smoke turkey, cheese, oil, onions, vinegar, tomatoes, pickles, and herbs. It was very oily -- in a good way. You know, the way that makes the hard bread soft enough t be chewy and requires you to sop? Yeah, sop. It's like that. And, I savored every bite. The hoagie can be a mess, but if you are prepared and stacked with napkins, you'll be fine. Of course, the best thing to drink with such a hoagie is a brightly-colored HFCS soda with a fruity name. As mentioned earlier, I chose grape and I was wise to do so. Eating my meal, I felt as though I was participating in a Chicago tradition and I felt honored to have done so. Taurus Flavors *is* Chicago and I am so pleased to have finally experienced it. Maybe next time I'll take advantage of the ice cream and cookie selection... and maybe = definitely.

35.description: This place is a few miles from me. The food is okay but I think it's over priced by $2.

8.description: I grew up, just down the street from Taurus Flavors! Every time I come back, to the Chi, Taurus Flavors is always on my list, of places to hit up before I leave! Hoagie! 87th 4 Life!

0.description: I am glad to have the opportunity to give a review for them. I can remember as a young girl my uncles introducing me to their wonderful sandwich. But as as an adult I have grown to love their lemon ice cream. I highly recommend this place for a good hoagy. P. S. Make sure you try their steak sandwich too. OMG!

20.description: Ever have a taste for a really good hoagy or steak sandwich?  It doesn't get any better than this.  I've been eating these sandwiches since I was in high school.  There's always standing room only here (there's no place to sit down).  It's truly a carry out only establishment.  They also ONLY take cash, but the prices are so good, you'll have enough.  Their service fast, and they keep the line moving. Wednesday is discount day so if you don't want to stand in a long line, pick another day.

I can't speak for factors 1 or 3, but 2 impressed me and I can see why people flock from all over to get their mitts on one of these hoagies.They're delicious. Simply put.
