33.description: Good steak sandwich, the sauce is what makes it yummy.

2.description: I've been eating Taurus flavor's steak sandwich sweet for years and they never let me down. Everything they have is the bomb! But, there is nothing like there steak sandwiches in the whole wide world. Trust me!

34.description: This place is pretty good. The service is ok. Very no nonsense so make sure you know what you want. It's super crowded on Wednesdays due to their awesome hoagies specials. I love the chicken breast hoagie. The bread is always fresh and I love the oil and sweet peppers. This place is definitely becoming one of my favorites. Screw subway!

32.description: This line has the potential to be out the door in the dead of winter. The sandwiches are made fresh to order and is fye as hell! Double steak no peppers or a large turkey w/oil. Back in the day when I was youngin and my metabolism was much faster I would get a steak AND a turkey and max it in one sitting. Can't do that anymore :(( Great place for dirt cheap good food!

18.description: I can walk here but choose to drive to Home of the Hoagy.  I like their food so much better.  The hoagies here are ok but the steak sandwich is just plain awful.

13.description: I can't live without Taurus Flavors. I always get a large ham hoagy extra sweet. My favorite location is the one on 85th and Stony. Been eating hoagies since I was 8. Catch the bus from the west side once a week and go there. The 3 footers are only $13.50 abs its big as Hell. I'm lovin' it!

4.description: Um, so I came here in the summer (forgot to review) and I could have sworn when I was younger that Taurus Flavors was called such because of the ice cream. They had their own ice cream. It was so much better than Baskin Robins, or so I remembered. I was soooo craving some chocolate chip ice cream. I remembered that the ice cream was this amazing vanilla and the chocoalate chips weren't chips at all, but these long straw like things. Yums...So I go inside and stand in line with about 20 other people...who are all ordering hoagies...what? I don't remember this part of Taurus Flavor. Now it is Chicago and people do love their meat, but there has to still be ice cream, right?By the time I made it to the register I found out there were like 3 flavors...whomp. Served in a styrofoam cup. whomp. whomp. I waited all that time so I got the ice cream and left. So disappointed. I am happy they have handmade signs though. Good to see a place still in business, although it doesnt' look like it's the same owner. whomp.

24.description: Best hoagies EVER! I grew up eating these and thankfully it is not near my home. I would definitely be in trouble if it was.  Definitely a must try, but you will get addicted.

6.description: The steak hoagie is to die for I crave that sandwich like a drug what can I say I just love this place

22.description: i use to come here a lot when i was younger for ice cream, i would get chocolate chip and my little sister would always get bubble gum. it wasn't until I was a teenager that i discovered their sandwiches. i wasnt really into the hoagies but I fell in love with the steak sandwich it was sooo good, that sweet tangy sauce, the tender beef and the soft roll. well i was out with a friend of mine and after a night of getting slapped it was time to go home as soon as i got into her car the aroma of hoagie hit me she had bought it for some dude but for some reason she ended up not giving it to him lucky for me, after scraping the lettuce and the other junk i dont like i ate one of the best sandwiches i have had in a long time it was so good that the next day after heavy weekend day drinking i had to go get a steak and boy did it not disappoint. i fell in love all over again

15.description: This is one of my favorite spot good sandwich and good prices can't beat it!!! It's always busy so you know it's got it be good check it out

7.description: My mom used to bring me here as a kid, this is really a drop in and go place... I'm not trying to be judgemental but due to the type of crowd it draws, I would be hesitant to bring kids in for picking up the food.  The hoagies are great though, full of flavor, but not as flavorful as the home of the hoagy on 111th street.  I still will continue to visit when I want to indulge in a hoagy!

36.description: this is the place u go to if you lookin for a kickass hoagy or steak sanwich. the service is good and the food is one that shows what its all about over here on the southside of Chicago. the hoagies come in small, medium, and large, whereas, the steak sandwiches come in a small and a large. expect to pay anywhere from 4 to 6 bucks

30.description: Yeah, the sandwiches are good. I go here repeatedly, no problem with this place at all! The steaks are B-I just wish Home of the Hoagie was closer! A++

3.description: This lace has been apart of the community since 1966...That's just one year shy of 50 YEARS! Best Taste'n "Old Fashioned" Steak Sandwich in the South side of Chicago...Period! Juicy and tender slices of steack with onions, hot and sweet peppers...BAM! Great hand-packed ice cream, too! Only thing is...you better be ready to wait in line! This place is busy from lunch time til close!

14.description: Definitely a HOOD CLASSIC!!!  I grow up loving them and will continue to support this community business.  Supreme Steak...YUM!!!!!

3.description: Visited this shop today for the first time and my experience was very pleasant. The stylist that I saw was Zelda who is absolutely amazing and her chair side manner is wonderful. I will definitely be booking with Zelda into the summer..

1.description: The only reason why I'm giving this place 2 stars because my stylist individually was the bomb.When I got my hair done here, there was a young lady with a short blonde cut on the left side. I can't remember her name (below will tell the story) but she did a phenomenal job... still used barrel irons (which I loved) and my hair lasted forever. I had a sew in and she did a wash and style for 65$. I was planning on scheduling another appointment for a bob but until today. I had been referring people to this salon over and over. This time, my mother needed a new place to go. She's older and has a lot of questions. She called the salon and the receptionist was beyond rude to the point of my mother, the sweetest lady in the world, calling me cursing about her horrible experience and how the receptionist was rude, nasty and wouldn't answer simple questions, like "is a specific stylist still working there?" I'm confused, as I've recommended black senior leaders at my job to the shop, called the salon because this is also my brand. The receptionist was even more rude to me, I had to wait a good five minutes (after getting interrogated) to speak to the owner. After speaking to the owner, she was calm and listened. She only finished with a "Thank you for letting me know," and we hung up.I think it's so beautiful that black businesses are doing so well that a rude receptionist can lose potential clients/money and they can be just fine with it. Hats off to you sis, your next venture should be teaching a business course at Harvard focusing on how in 2015 first point of contacts no longer represent the brand.

2.description: I've been a client of Angie's for over 20 years. I love the experience I have going to get my hair done. The environment is clean and the clientele and other stylist are very friendly. If you are looking to get an awesome hairstyle in a warm, friendly, and professional environment, then Angie's Hair Salon is definitely for you!

9.description: I went to Angie's for 2 months and there were a few things I didn't like. First off, if your appointment is at 10am, expect to spend the half the day there because they will book 20 people under that same time slot. The waiting time is crazy. Then once I've waited for 6hrs after my wash & dry then it takes only 15-20min to style my hair. I thought to myself damn, something so simple it takes almost 7hrs  to complete. It's crazy to wait that long for a simple wash and press!!!!

10.description: I scheduled an appointment with Paulette at 4 pm on a Thursday. She was very professional and pleasant on the phone.  I arrived about 20 minutes early. I was informed that she wasn't there yet. No big deal since I was early. At about 4:15, I inquired about my appointment. Another stylist, who was pleasant as well, informed me that I was next to be shampooed. At about 4:30, a rude shampoo girl came over and asked who I was there for. I told her Paulette and she said OK then walked away. At 4:45,  I was still waiting along with two other clients with no word from the stylist or the shampoo girl. At 4:50, I grabbed my coat and left. Everyone in the salon watched me walk out of the door without a word. No one ever contacted me to apologize or reschedule. I live in Evanston and I only drove all the way out there because I heard such good things about the stylist. After my experience, I would not recommend her to anyone.

4.description: Prior to finding Angie's salon on Instagram in September 2014, my hair was very brittle and limp. HOWEVER, now after six months my hair is healthy and long. I would definitely recommend my stylist, Regina, to anyone with short and long hair!

6.description: My stylist has always been Shaleah, and I love coming here! The salon has a fun atmosphere, everyone is very friendly and informative, and the architecture is flawless.  They offer a few TVs while you wait, and once you are in the chair, service is FAST! Went in for a color after getting my hair trimmed and Shaleah once again did a fantastic job! This location is also convenient for me to drive to, which is a big plus.

12.description: did a great job on my daughters damaged hair!!!!!! i am now a fan great service.

5.description: I have lived here for over seven years, an I have run into plenty of hair stylist, but never anyone like Ray. She is personal, on time, did an excellent job on my hair and very patient. She took the time to explain what and why this would be best for  my hair. Although, the salon is not in the best area Angie's hair salon is clean and the other hair stylist are great as well. You may come in feeling down, but leaving feeling like a million dollars. I must say my experiences here has been great. Thanks

11.description: It's so refreshing to find a classy salon where the staff/owner are friendly and they do good work.  I was very pleased with my hair and the overall service.  I'm definitely planning on becoming a regular.

8.description: First visit review:My stylist was Zelda. I went for shampoo, flat iron and hot oil treatment. Left the salon with bouncy, curly and healthy looking hair. Zelda was an excellent stylist, not overly talkative, but very personable. She took time to get to know me and my hair, particularly preference to style and home care routine. My hair is natural and it was great that she did not use too many or too much product...I didn't even have to tell her! The best part I booked same day and I was in and out in less than 1.5 hrs....no overbooking (I may be a southern belle, but I hate waiting)!!The salon itself is very nice, the music is not blasted, and the stylist keep conversation at a nice professional level. It felt very professional and quiet despite several stylists and customers. There was no yelling across the salon or gossiping. There are plenty of dryers so u don't have to wait with wet hair!! Salon provides a large and comfy waiting area. Beautifully decorated with an open floor plan. My only con is that on line booking is available and credit cards are accepted, but you have to double check with each stylist first. There is a beautiful front desk area, but no one is there to greet you or check u in.Overall, this a diamond in the rough! A modern, professional salon that's probably overlooked because of it's area. Quality work at a great price.Pls note I did go on a Thursday afternoon.

0.description: Not only is the owner awesome, personally she rocks as a stylist. Each stylist within her salon reflects her personality and spiritual growth. They are very passionate about hair and innovative with the latest styles and product... been a faithful customer for literally 20yrs.

7.description: Great place to go for your hair appointments. I have had Jamila as a stylist for about two years. She takes great care of my hair. Saturdays are pretty busy so I usually try to go during the week in order to be in and out in about 2 hours. All of the stylist are very nice ladies and the salon is very clean!

0.description: This neighborhood beauty suppy has all your hair need products but I think they are ready to give it it. I went into the establishment 15 minutes before they close and could not get serviced. I wanted to look at some hair but was told to come back tomorrow bc they were. about to close. It wasn't busy, actually when I walked in I was the only one there. Then about 2min lat er someone else came in. Not sure what the rush was for to close but I guess they makin it good. Since you dont need my money I will go someplace else. It was good while it lasted... Another neighborhood business going to the dogs!.

3.description: I wish I could give this location a ZERO for their terrible customer service. The girl working the drive thru never said a word. Didn't speak, give me my total say thank you, she didn't even smile. Just rude! How can she possibly work in customer service?! My sandwich was dry like they re warmed it. I'll never eat Wendy's again and I feel like complaining to corporate because every time I go to this location its always terrible customer service!

1.description: The craziest fast food experience I have ever had! Ordered a combo for one person and the drive thru order screen was frozen so I could not confirm the order. Upon arriving at the window, I am told I owe over $13 and am given a receipt for someone else's order. Despite giving back the wrong food three times, they could not get it right and I gave up. This drive through is complete chaos. And the drive thru attendant cannot make change at all.

2.description: A good neighborhood fast food restaurant. New menu featuring 4 for $4. Less expensive than the meals! Good for a add on too!

5.description: The driver thru cashiers are so disrespect. I remember when my mother was the manager for this location. Everyone was friendly and smiled. Several years later and with new management even after the update this establishment still hasn't gotten better.

6.description: The drive thru lines tend to be a little long sometimes, but they move fairly quickly. My orders are always accurate and fresh, besides the one time my fries were barely half full.The berry almond chicken salad is one of my favorites.

7.description: No icecream? really? in a heatwave like this?! wow...#6 with fruit punch. #thatisall

0.description: Super pleased upon realizing that there is a Wendy's here!  Great experience today--quick service and delicious, inexpensive food.

4.description: If i could give this location zero stars I would. I blame myself for giving them more than one chance. They are constantly sending out wrong orders...get snippy when you correct them and are unprofessional both in person and over the drive thru speaker. This location remodeled but didn't loose the dead weight employees. It's not my fault you work the night shift at Wendy's maybe if you had a better attitude you would land a better job. Stay clear! Drive down to the one on Ashland if Wendy's food is what you are craving.

58.description: For one, I hope we all know to NEVER pay attention to someone with no friends and one or two reviews. For two, this place is still fantastic! We love it! Best ticket prices around. Especially when there is a groupon. The food really isn't that overpriced. I wish I could be present and sitting next to anyone who has had a bad experience here. I'm 6'2" and while I can't go around folding one leg over the other I am FAR from being uncomfortable. Anyone that is shorter than 6 foot that feels uncomfortable was probably not hugged enough when they were a kid. Live the dream, eat and watch a movie at the same time. My motto in life, don't listen to idiots. Enjoy!

56.description: Way better than I expected.We came in on a $5 groupon, but it is only $7 on Tuesday & Thursday anyway, I don't understand any whining about not being senior or children priced friendly or the food overpriced. Pretty slick way to wrap up dinner AND a movie. Very friendly movie staff and servers. Looks like a pretty safe place to drop your kids, or seniors off.I trusted Howard C. on this one, and he was right. This place is better than ok, tons of legroom (don't trip the servers ;~) and prices aren't that bad for a night out. Tues and Thursay there are specials like $1.25 for sliders, $3 drafts and $5 off a pitcher of beer, and we liked the largeish $6 house salad, onions rings pretty good, and the sweet potato fries looked even better. Service isn't super fast but just relax into being served in the movie theater, I liked it. I also like carrying Turkey salad into the Catlow from BOLONEY'S. Getting there about 30 minutes early is perfect so you don't have to do the cellphone flashlight on your menus, your neighbors will appreciate that.I had expected the servers and neighbors eating to bother me but it wasn't bad at all, and I did have a cell phone flashlight menu reading neighbor, but it actually made it a little more guilt free when you were whispering to your partner during the movie, because so was everybody else, quietly. It is a little tricky to get out of the seats with the table in front of you but I still like to hold my food down when I can.I didn't see the magic of the 4k screen, my plasma is definitely better, but good enuf and the sound was fine. Our screen was kind of over on the left side of the room for some reason, like somebody very non-Union afterhours hung that one.We are fans, try it.

29.description: This theater is amazing. Definitely my favorite that I've ever been to! Best in the area. They have great specials, service is excellent, environment is classy, and it is in a great location.

42.description: A girlfriend and mine went and saw a movie and ate dinner here for the first time last week and we are definitely coming back!!!  The food is absolutely wonderful!!  Seriously delicious!!  The service was great and promt and the table is right in front of you so easy to eat!  The drinks are nothing to ride home about though. Downfall is that the chairs don't recline all the way major disappointment but for the food alone we will be back!!!

23.description: This movie theater was the best experience I ever had at any theater! Initially we went there because we were hungry as well. Did you know Tuesday and Thursday are the best days! $7 movies and so many discounts on food AND drinks! When you sit down, in front of you is a table along with a menu and paper to order. Once you press the button your host or hostess will arrive to take order!! How cool is that! I love their exceptional customer service. Special shout out to our host Nick for being prompt and friendly as well as the manager on duty April 30th 10:30p show. My friend left her purse there. After realizing when we got home, we called and she literally waited until 1:30 in the morning to hand off the bag. WOAH!! Definitely a company who cares about their customers. Please take anyone there or just yourself because it is an awesome experience! I will be returning!

47.description: Came here got great service, good selection of drinks and comfortable seats. I would definitely come here again recommend this to others. I will say this the food was mediocre and it's a little chilly in the theatre so you better eat your food fast.

8.description: Pros:It's a good place to take your kids, there is no flashy food ads. The seats are comfy.Cons:Don't order the food, its bad and it's late. Go to Panera Bread before your show.But if you do order food it's a hit or miss, today it took 1 hr to get our food and drinks the movie is almost over,  and it was an 11am show with only about 15 people at the movie.  The food was cold and did not taste fresh. So far 3 out of 3 times I got stomach pain from the food.

31.description: We love Star Cinema Grill!!  We live close, so we just walk on over at least a couple of times per month.  Some things that I love in particular about this place is that there is a fairly well stocked bar that you can grab a drink at prior to the movie, the chairs in the theater are leather (seems much more sanitary for a public setting), there is a pretty decent selection of food and it's actually good, the tickets are basically the same price as any other theater (and sometimes you can even land a deal from Groupon), and the swanky women's bathroom.:)

34.description: When they get it right it's a great experience. That said I've been 3 times and 2/3 times my food order never came. I thought the first time was a fluke but twice? I hope they worked out the kinks because it's nice little theatre to have locally.

16.description: There for the first time last week.  Service was good and food was not bad either.  Buffalo chicken wrap could have used better cuts of chicken but still good.

13.description: Since the only other dine-in theater I have been to is the Hollywood Palms, I will have to use it as a comparison. Let me start off by saying that the inside of this place is great! Beautiful soft seats, a lovely bar as you walk in, a very upscale looking bathroom and beautiful murals of movie icons on the walls. The owners of the theater definitely took time to make this place look like a five-star establishment. However, appearances can be deceiving. First off, ordering works on a paging system. You hit a little button on the front of your table and it is supposed to signal a server to come to your table. I thought that was pretty neat and would be useful in the dark! We arrived in the middle of the previews and met our group, and a server came to take our drink orders. I had a Poolside Lemonade, and my partner had the Castaway. We also ordered the Texas-style potato skins with no onions. Our drinks did not come until 15 minutes into the movie, about half an hour after we ordered, and the potato skins came with onions on them. We sent them back and waited some more. Our drinks had absolutely no alcohol in them, mine was essentially juice. I tasted my partner's and it was just lime juice and ginger beer. A different server brought us our potato skins again with no onions, and we asked to exchange the Castaway for an Anti-Hero (beer). The server responded, "You need to push your button." Rude! He couldn't even say, "Let me get your server," or "Sure, let me inform your server." I thought that was rude. Any other restaurant would have just taken the order. My partner ordered his entree with his drink and our appetizer, and I ordered mine a little bit later, but they both came out at the same time, about halfway through the movie. What took so long? I ordered the Chicken Run sandwich, grilled chicken with provolone cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo. It came with seasoned fries. Fries were pretty standard fries. This sandwich tasted exactly like the chicken club sandwich from McDonald's, including rubbery chicken and rubbery bacon, but I was pretty hungry and was not going to wait until the movie was over to get another entree. My partner had the Porky's burger, he said it was good. We only saw our server when he took our appetizer/drink order and when he was giving us the check. I was incredibly disappointed in the food and experience at this theater. I am even more disappointed knowing that they are taking over the Hollywood Palms. Hollywood Palms has an amazing system, where orders are taken almost as soon as you sit down and the food comes out as it is ready and it is always hot and delicious. The drinks definitely have alcohol in them, the servers will get you whatever you need, no matter if they are your server or not, and there is always a server in the theater! You don't need to press a stupid button to page someone who may or may not come. I pressed the button once or twice and each time it took about 10/15 minutes for someone to get there. High volume is not really an excuse either, as HP has about the same volume of customers and gets the food and orders out quickly and correctly. I will not be returning to Star Cinema Grill, and if they implement the same policies and procedures at the Hollywood Palms in Naperville, they will lose my business as well.

11.description: This movie theater was the best experience I ever had at any theater! Initially we went there because we were hungry as well. Did you know Tuesday and Thursday are the best days! $7 movies and so many discounts on food AND drinks! When you sit down, in front of you is a table along with a menu and paper to order. Once you press the button your host or hostess will arrive to take order!! How cool is that! I love their exceptional customer service. Special shout out to our host Nick for being prompt and friendly as well as the manager on duty April 30th 10:30p show. My friend left her purse there. After realizing when we got home, we called and she literally waited until 1:30 in the morning to hand off the bag. WOAH!! Definitely a company who cares about their customers. Please take anyone there or just yourself because it is an awesome experience! I will be returning!

39.description: It's a cute place to watch a movie and have dinner and drinks at the same time. They have a bar right before you walk into your show room. You can also order drinks from the show room itself.  Once you are seated inside, your table has a couple menus and a button you can press whenever you wish to order something. The staff has always been friendly whenever we go. If you're going to get a drink I highly recommend the "Tropic Thunder".

37.description: The theaters are very nice but the food is fantastic with very reasonable prices. I'd like to go there just for the food!

0.description: Great movie theater. The concept is awesome but it can be a little slow to get service if the movie theater is full. The food is pretty good and can add up quick but usually Tuesday's and Thursdays are discounted so that can help keep the costs down. Parking there is brutal but that's not their fault.

38.description: Great experience with nephew. Only complaint is that it was very cold in the theater. Other than that- great service, great ambiance.

51.description: It's really an awesome theater, full bar, with a full restaurant. It's gluten free friendly with a a lot or tasty options. They even have an awesome gluten free pizza. They have underground parking and the other patrons are always nice and respectful. It's a nice date spot or place to grab dinner and a movie with a friend or family. I really wish more theaters would cater to the customer the way this place does.

27.description: Best movie theatre in the area!!!!!  Food and drinks are really good and seats r comfy. I won't go anywhere else. We're regulars.

32.description: i absolutely love star cinema grill! the prices are extremely reasonable, the food is pretty darn good (esp for a movie theater), and you don't need to get up during the middle of the movie to go get some popcorn. what could be better?

54.description: My husband and I saw Maleficent at this theater tonight. It is a clean theater located in cute downtown Arlington Heights. My poor review reflects the food and drinks we had for dinner. I ordered a cocktail with berries and mint: it was $10 and the glass was so small. My husband ordered their signature mac and cheese; it was just ok and lacked flavor. I ordered the "Tony Montana" sandwich: pulled pork, ham, cheese, pickles, mayo. The bread was very tough and hard to eat, pulled pork was really dry bc it had no sauce, and the cheese was gross. Our bill was over $40 not including the movie tickets. It the food was better, we would go back.

48.description: Great movies, food and service. Get the Groupons when you can. They have specials on Tuesdays and Thursdays: $1 Sliders, $5 off select beer pitchers and $7 tickets all day.This is truly a hidden gem. Definitely better than Muvico any day. Never crowded and hardly any screaming or crying kids. Perfect for dates or a get together with friends.

44.description: Amazing food, service and ambience plus the management is professional and savvy. I've been here on two occasions already and have had the chicken mac n cheese, buffalo chicken wrap, mozzarella sticks and the Chicago Hot Dog. The food is fresh and well made. Also, they show all the Bears games for free in theatre 1.

24.description: Just went to see Mad Max here. In the last minutes of the movie the waiter comes over to take away plates and collect the check. Since I'm WATCHING A MOVIE, I had not taken the time to sort out how much the bill was, or how I was going to pay, nor would I have been able to see in a dark theater to do so. I Intended to pay the bill as soon as I could see after the movie ended. Instead the waiter crouches in front of and us and just waits there for me to pay the bill. So I guess instead of watching the end of the movie I'm expected to figure out a tip and count money in a dark theater. I went to reach for my wallet and in the process knock the soda over in the cup holder all over my lap and seat. Movie going experience completely ruined. I will not be returning to this theater ever. Beside the awful customer service the food is one step below the worst bar food I've ever had.

7.description: Bought Star Wars tickets on line for 6 people. Arrived and the theater was full. Theater was oversold.  At first we were scolded for not arriving 45 minutes before the movie started.  Then told we were wrong because the computer is always right. Silver lining, sweet girl went into the theater and returned to say "yea, we oversold, sorry."

49.description: Star Cinema Grill was very nicely decorated, has nice bathrooms and is well kept. My boyfriend and I went last night to catch a late Transformers 4 show. He ordered a drink and he liked it. We had just come from dinner so we didn't get any food. I will definitely go there again.

40.description: I love this place! Certainly  my husband and my favorite movie theater.  In the past year and a half, we've gone here at least a month. It is decent expensive,  the tickets are $10-12 per person, but only $5 on Tuesday.  The drinks  are quite  pricey,  not too many food and drink specials, but the experience  of eating and drinking  during a movie  is a lot of fun. The theaters  are also clean and the staff is friendly. The bathroom sinks are cool too. You can also order tickets online ahead of time I think.I forgot to mention  the food- I love their fries! I've also gotten the chicken tenders which are alright and the sliders on Tuesdays which are good

53.description: This is generous. Went to a Rated R movie at 1pm. As the movie was starting a family walked in and had a child under the age of 1. The baby constantly whimpered and cried. A half hour into the movie I went to speak to the manager. The manager stated,"there's no age restriction in a child when with an adult." He could not believe I had an issue, nor did he try to resolve the issue. I asked if my friends with all their babies could come and he said, "there is no age restriction." I will never come again!!

30.description: This is the closest dinner and movie experience to me. My fiancee and I enjoy going here, especially on weeknights when we want to watch a movie but don't have time to get dinner and watch a movie afterwards.The food isn't great, but it's good. We've been here at least 10 times and never had a bad experience.

46.description: This is the coolest, nicest, cleanest, best movie theatre I've ever been to! This is my first time coming to a theatre that services food and you can eat while you watch a movie. The menu has practically everything. I had the burger with fries and a drink. The drink is huge and the portions are more than enough. The seats are so roomy, nice and white. You have a lot of leg room in front of you which I like. You have a little table in front of you. It was a really great experience.  The movie theatre even had a bar outside which was really cool. Everything was great and I love the fact that the movie theatre is really clean. Even the bathrooms are really nice. I definitely can't wait to go back. I've been dreaming about it!

1.description: Star Cinema Grill is a different kind of movie experience, which didn't sit well with me and explains why I'm only giving it two stars. The layout of the theater is a lot flatter than usual, with paired, big chairs indicated by tables in front of them. You sit down, and pull out a menu from the table. You can press a button on your table to have a waiter awkwardly crouch towards you and take your order, and they do full service as if you were in a restaurant while the movie is playing.The food I've gotten here is good enough, but it's expensive like all movie theaters are. The service makes it hard to be entrenched into a movie, even if you're not the one ordering food because waiters will be crouching around you for other customers. This just wasn't my ideal place to see a movie. If I want to spent $10 to see a movie, you better believe I'm watching the movie and not wanting to be distracted. I recommend this place for date nights or for a time you want dinner and a movie in one experience, but aren't hooked on what the movie actually is.

55.description: I really like this theater - it is so out of the way for us that it seems like our little secret.  Besides that, the theater is so adorable.  The decor, the bar (yes I said the bar), the bathrooms are awesome.  The theaters are really nice.  The food, in my opinion is very reasonably priced.  It's comparable to eating at a restaurant, but you get it brought to you in the movie theater.  The only item that I thought was overpriced were the sodas/iced tea.  over $3, and no free refills - however, they are pretty big glasses.  As far as taste, everything we had was pretty good!!Every person that helped us was super-nice, making the experience so much fun, from the girl who sold us our ticket, to the young man who thanked us for coming.  We will definitely be returning here - even though it is pretty far from where we live.

9.description: Awesome concept. Family friendly, very comfortable, just a great place for movies. Plenty of parking underground.

26.description: I always go to Star Cinema Grill with my best friend to watch a movie. The food is good, the seats are comfy, good movies and wonderful staff.

25.description: I love the idea of eating (or even just getting a snack) while I'm watching a movie. I went here with 2 other people today.You buy your ticket, go in the theater, pick a seat. There are tables in front of the seats. They kinda go by twos, I guess for couples or something. Then there are menus in little slots under the tables. You can either write down what you want on the papers (also in slots under the tables) or you can press a button on the table to get a server to take your order.We ordered Margherita pizza and onion rings. Just a little snack to munch on while we watched the movie. The food was alright. I've had better, but it wasn't terrible either. I want to try the other stuff on the menu tho & the drinks too.I loved it. It's perfect for date night or just a night out with friends. The service was great too. Although I wanted to take the leftover pizza home after the movie so I pressed the button & nobody came? Maybe I was too late or something. The bathrooms are really nice. Actually, the whole place looks new & clean & nice. I think I'll be back soon.

12.description: This place is great! Better than Muvico, better than Hollywood Cinemas and Palms and worth the drive to the burbs. Food is a lil over priced but the menu has regular updates and friendly to everyone, gluten free, vegan, veggie, etc.

59.description: Food is decent. Sites are very comfortable. Greta atmosphere!! Definitely way to spend evening in Arlington Heights!!!

21.description: I would give zero stars if yelp allowed me. I had seen a movie here recently and everything was nice. Saw their advertisement for the Blackhawks Stanley Cup Viewing Party (game was on one of their theatre screens and everyone sat in seats like a normal movie). It sounded like a cool way to watch the game so I invited two other people with me. We arrived and commented the designated theatre seemed warm but gladly took our seats. The game began and we ordered some drinks as the room was getting hotter. We then ordered food which took almost an hour to be delivered to our seats (nachos are not an hour worthy wait!). We also ordered candy and due to the warmth of the theatre melted in the martini glasses the candy is served. The couple next to us were given the wrong drinks and food. We watched as other fans brought up the temperature to staff and one male associate loudly told the customer they were wrong and the air conditioning was on (well it might be on but it definitely was not working). We pay our tabs and leave from our drenched seats. The next day I check my bank statements and I was overcharged 60 dollars by the theatre. I stop by the theatre that day and speak to a manager (after asking an associate for the manager the first response was, "actually we are looking for him and can't seem to find him"). After explaining the situation about my account and receipt from the night before in hand, I'm told by the manager that I have to wait for the entire transaction to go thru and only after it has been completed can they give me credit. He then offers to handle the situation with better customer service and gives me an envelope, I look in it outside and was given one free movie pass. Overall, as a resident of Arlington Heights I'm appalled by a local business treating customers in such a fashion and making so many mistakes in one experience. I've never written a negative review for an establishment but felt this experience deserved such treatment.

17.description: I really like this theater - it is so out of the way for us that it seems like our little secret.  Besides that, the theater is so adorable.  The decor, the bar (yes I said the bar), the bathrooms are awesome.  The theaters are really nice.  The food, in my opinion is very reasonably priced.  It's comparable to eating at a restaurant, but you get it brought to you in the movie theater.  The only item that I thought was overpriced were the sodas/iced tea.  over $3, and no free refills - however, they are pretty big glasses.  As far as taste, everything we had was pretty good!!Every person that helped us was super-nice, making the experience so much fun, from the girl who sold us our ticket, to the young man who thanked us for coming.  We will definitely be returning here - even though it is pretty far from where we live.

10.description: This movie theater has a great menu to go along with their movies.  Not sure how the food is as I did not order anything.  Next time I will give the food a try.  The three star rating comes from how VERY COLD the theater was.  We kept our coats, hats and mittens on throughout the movie.  Part way through the movie I did ask a usher if some heat could be turned on.  It never happened.

5.description: Visited on 12/29  ordered food and got horribly sick which required an emergency visit where I was told i had food poisoning. Star cinema was the only place I ate and when I called to tell them what happened ( more to inform them, not looking for a refund) they ignored me. Called again, asked how I knew it was that I got sick from their food). I was shocked. Anyhow if u do go, I wouldn't eat the food, not worth the risk. Wish management cared about their customers.

3.description: Service has always been good at this place. Went to see Kung Fu Panda 3 on 2/06. Ordered nachos for myself, that was the worse nachos ever. The cheese was underneath the nachos, instead of on top. The cheese was so thin, it was like water. Hopefully next time it will be better. And to the couple that sat next to me. If you want to have a conversation, take out to the bar. They were pretty much talking during the first half of the movie. Of all the available seats, you had to put your kids in the back, and you and your bad breath boyfriend had to sit next to me.

35.description: Great Theater. Wide comfy seats. Nobody kicking your seat from behind. Push a button and a quick food and drink service right at your seat. I would recommend getting your payment ready , if you purchase something, before movie starts. I found it somewhat distracting to be digging out my credit card in the dark while trying to watch the end of the movie.

19.description: I like to see movies here because I don't have to get out of my seat to order beer.That is all.

28.description: I really wanted to give this place 4 or 5 stars considering the location and the cool setup on the inside.....but....the food.  It might have been the worst I have ever ordered off a menu.  I'm not one of those people who sends stuff back, but I was close.Shrimp tacos were awful.Positives:Very friendly serverCheap matinee pricesCool (and clean) venueLocation, location, location: love downtown AHThe positives are enough to let me give this place another try - hopefully the food will be edible.

45.description: They have very good food for a theater. Better than all the others we have been too. Love the push button service through out the movie. Gold Class used to do it but stopped when it changed to iPic. The service here is excellent. And they show football on the big screen. Sold.

33.description: I can't believe I haven't written a review for this place. It is absolutely hands down the best movie theater. The service is great, the food is awesome (especially the wings) and the chairs/ space is really great. I'm spoiled and I usually don't go to another theater after going to this one!

43.description: We had an impromptu family night out. I don't even know where I heard about this theater, but I'm glad we went! I actually liked this MUCH MUCH better than the other dinner and a movie place in Barington. This was REGULAR food. The servers were great - prompt and courteous. The screen and sound was excellent quality. My sandwich (a cuban of sorts) was awesome. My son's pizza was good. And the popcorn was real movie popcorn - not prepackaged yuckiness we've gotten at other dinner/movie places. I didn't get around to ordering my drink. The whole experience - popcorn, drinks, dinner and tickets was $100 for our family of four. I don't know that we could have gotten the same deal if we went to the AMC and Chilis. I hope it sticks around. Also, the mgr heard me say how great a time I had and he looked genuinely pleased, which was nice.

2.description: Note: I will update this review if I go back and have a better experience. I also plan on sending this review to Star Cinema via email. It's the holidays right? We're all busy, and trying to make time for family & friends. That's exactly what I was doing on 12/29 when I took my 15 year old sister (who lives in MI) to see Sisters. This theater is super close to my house so we opted to go here. We get to the ticket line and the girl warns us that the theater we're in is sans-heat. Has been for a few hours. Doesn't apologize, she's basically just warning us. My sister insists she'll be fine so we go for it. When I ask about the Tuesday $7 special the girl says (even though the heat is out and it's "really cold in there") that they don't offer it during the holiday season. Um...ok. Kinda lame but fine. Then we  get into the theater and it is FRIGID! Ice cold! My husband even had to drive a sweatshirt to us for my sister. Then I see the wait staff coming in with hot beverages. I think "oh, maybe they're handing out complimentary cocoa for all their patrons willing to pay full price to sit through this". WRONG AGAIN! They offered ZERO compensation! I'm not looking for anything for free here, really, but no one even apologized! No vouchers for a discount in the future, nothing! Not even small popcorn- and you KNOW they up charge like crazy for movie theater popcorn! They weren't going to lose money on us. At the very least honor your daily special admission price. It was really disappointing as far as customer service goes. Personally, if I'm a manager there and I know this heat has been off for HOURS, I'm running to Wal-mart for blankets (which I can expense) or at least offering people something hot to drink. With all the other theaters in the area (unfortunately we wouldn't make it to another one with a decent show time in this case- and I had to work the next morning) I'll definitely think twice before going back.

18.description: We had an impromptu family night out. I don't even know where I heard about this theater, but I'm glad we went! I actually liked this MUCH MUCH better than the other dinner and a movie place in Barington. This was REGULAR food. The servers were great - prompt and courteous. The screen and sound was excellent quality. My sandwich (a cuban of sorts) was awesome. My son's pizza was good. And the popcorn was real movie popcorn - not prepackaged yuckiness we've gotten at other dinner/movie places. I didn't get around to ordering my drink. The whole experience - popcorn, drinks, dinner and tickets was $100 for our family of four. I don't know that we could have gotten the same deal if we went to the AMC and Chilis. I hope it sticks around. Also, the mgr heard me say how great a time I had and he looked genuinely pleased, which was nice.

41.description: We have been to this theatre many times and have always had a pleasant visit. However, I am a bit bent out of shape regarding tonights visit. We got to the theatre a few minutes before our movie was to start. There was no one at the booth to get our tickets. After standing outside, looking for someone we finally tried the doors. The first one was locked, but the second one was open so we went in. There was not one person around. We stood there for a few minutes and waited and waited and nothing. Finally, an employee came in who had been outside smoking and asked us if anyone was around. He then went and knocked on a door and the girl came running out. She was apologetic and rang up our tickets. When we left the theatre there was not a person in sight. This is very poor customer service. I'm not sure we'll be returning. It's not any cheaper to go here then any other theatre so we'll give our business to someone who wants it.

52.description: It's a nice theater.  Prices were a little high and parking can be a little challenging.  But the seats were comfortable

50.description: Go for the experience of seeing a movie while sitting in big comfy chairs & eating dinner and drinking a beer. The food has never been amazing, I would call it average or slightly below average, but it is fine for the situation. If you order a Martini it will take 15-20 minutes. Stick with the basics with the food (ie, cheeseburger and fries) They have Groupons every now and then too.

4.description: Absolutely fantastic experience!!! I have a feeling that Village of AH restricts them from doing something to the uninviting exterior but inside will blow you away. Very modern and clean. Food and drinks were surprisingly good (I did not expect to find quality food in the movie theater)

6.description: I love the idea of eating (or even just getting a snack) while I'm watching a movie. I went here with 2 other people today.You buy your ticket, go in the theater, pick a seat. There are tables in front of the seats. They kinda go by twos, I guess for couples or something. Then there are menus in little slots under the tables. You can either write down what you want on the papers (also in slots under the tables) or you can press a button on the table to get a server to take your order.We ordered Margherita pizza and onion rings. Just a little snack to munch on while we watched the movie. The food was alright. I've had better, but it wasn't terrible either. I want to try the other stuff on the menu tho & the drinks too.I loved it. It's perfect for date night or just a night out with friends. The service was great too. Although I wanted to take the leftover pizza home after the movie so I pressed the button & nobody came? Maybe I was too late or something. The bathrooms are really nice. Actually, the whole place looks new & clean & nice. I think I'll be back soon.

22.description: Since the only other dine-in theater I have been to is the Hollywood Palms, I will have to use it as a comparison. Let me start off by saying that the inside of this place is great! Beautiful soft seats, a lovely bar as you walk in, a very upscale looking bathroom and beautiful murals of movie icons on the walls. The owners of the theater definitely took time to make this place look like a five-star establishment. However, appearances can be deceiving. First off, ordering works on a paging system. You hit a little button on the front of your table and it is supposed to signal a server to come to your table. I thought that was pretty neat and would be useful in the dark! We arrived in the middle of the previews and met our group, and a server came to take our drink orders. I had a Poolside Lemonade, and my partner had the Castaway. We also ordered the Texas-style potato skins with no onions. Our drinks did not come until 15 minutes into the movie, about half an hour after we ordered, and the potato skins came with onions on them. We sent them back and waited some more. Our drinks had absolutely no alcohol in them, mine was essentially juice. I tasted my partner's and it was just lime juice and ginger beer. A different server brought us our potato skins again with no onions, and we asked to exchange the Castaway for an Anti-Hero (beer). The server responded, "You need to push your button." Rude! He couldn't even say, "Let me get your server," or "Sure, let me inform your server." I thought that was rude. Any other restaurant would have just taken the order. My partner ordered his entree with his drink and our appetizer, and I ordered mine a little bit later, but they both came out at the same time, about halfway through the movie. What took so long? I ordered the Chicken Run sandwich, grilled chicken with provolone cheese, bacon, lettuce, tomatoes, and mayo. It came with seasoned fries. Fries were pretty standard fries. This sandwich tasted exactly like the chicken club sandwich from McDonald's, including rubbery chicken and rubbery bacon, but I was pretty hungry and was not going to wait until the movie was over to get another entree. My partner had the Porky's burger, he said it was good. We only saw our server when he took our appetizer/drink order and when he was giving us the check. I was incredibly disappointed in the food and experience at this theater. I am even more disappointed knowing that they are taking over the Hollywood Palms. Hollywood Palms has an amazing system, where orders are taken almost as soon as you sit down and the food comes out as it is ready and it is always hot and delicious. The drinks definitely have alcohol in them, the servers will get you whatever you need, no matter if they are your server or not, and there is always a server in the theater! You don't need to press a stupid button to page someone who may or may not come. I pressed the button once or twice and each time it took about 10/15 minutes for someone to get there. High volume is not really an excuse either, as HP has about the same volume of customers and gets the food and orders out quickly and correctly. I will not be returning to Star Cinema Grill, and if they implement the same policies and procedures at the Hollywood Palms in Naperville, they will lose my business as well.

15.description: There's not many places where you can go in and dine while watching your movie. This is a great option to have, especially not having to leave your seat and miss a scene because you want a drink. The seats are relatively comfortable. The size of the table and the distance is good enough where nothing covers your view. My experience with the servers have all been positive. They are both speedy and respectful of their surroundings. I would have given this place a 4/5 stars but their ALWAYS changing policies are annoying. I had 2 expired Groupons I wanted to use today. I had paid $5 for each of them so regardless of when I would redeem them, they already have my $5 (there is no loss). First, don't be fooled by their Tuesday and Thursday all day $7 movies. If it's a premier, they will deny this advertisement and charge you $11.50, regardless of their displayed prices and your age (I saw them charge a 4 year old for #11.50). Expired Groupons will also be rejected (although in the Groupons policy, it clearly states that it can be redeemed anytime - but I'm not going to waste my time arguing). But I was told that if I come back tomorrow, I could use my expired Groupon that I had paid $5 for and get $5 off my movie, ALTHOUGH I would have gotten the SAME $5 today... logic?Would I go back? Sure, it's a good place to hit 2 birds with one stone. My lessons learned: if I'm getting a Groupon I better make sure I use it on time since this place is not so friendly about people redeeming expired ones. Oh, and always make sure to see if they changed their policy AGAIN... smh...

57.description: This movie theater is a hidden gem! We found out by accident this was a dine in movie theater. We just wanted to watch a movie after dinner and it happened to be in the same complex. We walk in and the first thing you see is this awesome bar with velvet cushioned chairs and I thought to myself, that's pretty nice for the movies! Then we realized it was literally a movie and dinner! Unfortunately we just had dinner but that didn't stop me from ordering a cheesecake in the middle of the movie! It's like being at home and getting a snack only better! Awesome place, next time we are coming back for actual dinner here as well

20.description: There's not many places where you can go in and dine while watching your movie. This is a great option to have, especially not having to leave your seat and miss a scene because you want a drink. The seats are relatively comfortable. The size of the table and the distance is good enough where nothing covers your view. My experience with the servers have all been positive. They are both speedy and respectful of their surroundings.
