Oh, and always make sure to see if they changed their policy AGAIN... smh...

36.description: The best theater in Illinois.My fiance and I really enjoyed this theater. The food was delicious. A wonderful environment. This was worth the 45 minute drive we took. Reasonable prices

14.description: Thanks to groupon my roommate and I found this hidden gem. Great food, very comfortable seats, and great customer service. I recommend their spicy bbq boneless wings and chips and queso! Very good!

3.description: While I was going to leave 4 Stars for Qiana's massage techniques, all my future prepaid appointments have been cancelled by Qiana. The 1 Star Rating is based on her unprofessionalism and inability to fulfill the 6 month biweekly in-home 60 minute massage deal purchased.

1.description: I bought a YouSwoop deal for a massage in my home. Unfortunately I will not be able to use it because it is impossible to make an appointment. Not only is she going on vacation the last 2 weeks of the voucher being valid, but when I tried to make an appointment via text message, I was told to "check on the website for availability." I can't even speak to a live person.Poor customer service.

2.description: I have been using Qiana's Massage for a year and a half on a very regular basis. I had spinal fusion surgery in May 2012 and there were complications. The drugs in the hospital were unable to control my pain. I have never experienced anything like it in my life. Qiana came to my home the day after I came home from the hospital. She immediately helped me to manage my pain. Without Qiana I have no idea how I would have ever recovered from my surgery. I would have become addicted to pain meds and would still be using my walker. THANK YOU!

5.description: I've been going to Qiana's Massage for almost six months and I've had only pleasant experiences. She is always professional, attentive and accommodating to whatever my needs are in a given session.  I normally prefer male masseuse because of there upper body strength but I was pleasantly surprised and not disappointed when referred to Qiana and experienced her deep tissue massage. GREAT PRICING$$. I intend to be her client for a long time!

6.description: I have been using Qiana for almost a year now and I'm hooked!  She is responsive, she is always on time and she gives amazing massages!  I fall asleep almost every time and never want to get off of the table!  She asks me every time if I have problem areas that she should attend to and she can go as light or as deep as you want/need her to. I have had no trouble making appointments and she gets back to me in a timely manner.  She's great!

7.description: I had my first massage yesterday and it was wonderful.  Qiana was wonderful and put me to sleep instantly.  I booked my appointment online and received a confirmation with minutes.  I also received a text message reminder the day of the massage.  I would definitely go back.

8.description: Qiana is amazing! She is my go-to in-home masseuse and my mother in law loves getting her massages in the comfort of her home. Give her a call, I assure you you'll be back for more!

9.description: I have received massages in in Chicago, Honolulu, The Marinara Islands, Thailand, and the Philippines. I recently received a 20 minute massage from Qiana, and received the best massage to date. She used an overwhelming amount of techniques that had me feeling very relaxed and refreshed. I view this as a direct reflection on her abilities and her mastery of the art of massaging. I definitely recommend fellow hard workers to experience a hand, whole arm, and leg massage after a labor intensive day as a treat for your own hard work. Thanks Qiana.

0.description: While it was a bit difficult for me to use the online scheduling system, once I had scheduled my first appointment I sent Qiana an email informing her of the problem.  She responded promptly to arrange some appointments with me.I have had three appointments with Qiana so far and I am very happy with her services.  She listened carefully when I explained what muscle issues I was having and she made sure to pay close attention to those areas.She is very friendly and personable and I am very happy with her services.

4.description: I don't recommend this place just because it is impossible to make a reservation.  I bought a voucher for massage at your location (that's what it said on the deal).  There are only 2 methods to make reservation, text her that don't always get response or book online.  I tried to book online a week ago for a massage in my home.  But the calendar has no avaiable through Feb. 11.  There is no calendar beyond Feb 11.  I requested my refund.

28.description: Absolutely loved my shrimp po' boy! OK so I may be a bit biased because its so close to my house and I just want you to stay forever Anita's Gumbo. Its great having another flavorful option.I thought the price was pretty reasonable and the food was good. My only suggestion would be to create a kids meal the chicken was good but the gumbo on the side was a bit spicy for my 3 year old.

1.description: Been wanting to try this gumbo and  today Was The day.Size: for $13.00 The gumbo had big chunks of sea scallops, shrimp and they give You a small cup of crab(very small) to add, shrimp and plenty andouille sausage and chicken.Taste: The roux is executed perfect I Was missing thyme and okra otherwise The flava Was good not GREAT...and there Was no trinity But worth trying, oh and it wasn't spicy to me as I added Tabasco hehehe...

9.description: Came to the restaurant  for the first time yesterday and I was very impressed. The food was awesome and the customer service was great. I will be a return customer.

29.description: Great food, the roux is delicious. I've had the gumbo wings with gumbo rice, the chicken gumbalaya, the chicken po boy and the signature flagship gumbo. Everything I listed had fresh ingredients and just right on the spice for my taste. The restaurant itself is very clean and the staff is friendly and real. I will be back in the future for more.

23.description: Decided to try this since they had a booth set up @ The South Side Soul Festival.  I tried the Gumbo Wings & The Seafood Gumbo.  The wings were nothing more than the wings having been "soaked" in the roux.  I didn't particularly care for them The Gumbo was pretty tasty however they probably should turn down the spice. It has a "kick" that will be too much for some people.  Overall I would buy the Gumbo again but not the wings

5.description: I stopped in Anita's Gumbo this evening after salivating thinking about delicious gumbo! I'm so glad I was determined to stop in because it was absolutely AMAZING! I ordered the Signature Gumbo and buttermilk wings! The Gumbo: nice kick of spice!  Delicious roux! Nice amount of crab, shrimp, chicken and sausage! The wings: Delish! I didn't get the wings with the roux on top since I figured it was pretty much the gumbo I had on the side. The customer service was excellent! Everyone was friendly, the owner was very personable as well! Thank you for bringing delicious Gumbo to Chicago! I'll be spreading the word and will also return!

31.description: They just opened on May 31st, 2014. Probably working out some kinks at the restaurant. So far I received carry-out for the Wednesday special Caribbean Gumbo. The roux is pretty good and it's not very spicy. Alittle lacking in the amount of meat and mostly rice, but i'll see what happens later.All menu items are made to order so anticipate waiting 10-20mins for your take-out food. Signs are posted.At the time of writing this review, their temporary hours of operation are:Sunday: ClosedMonday: ClosedTuesday: 11am-6pmWednesday: 11am-6pmThursday: 11am-6pmFriday: 11am-7pmSaturday: 11am-7pm

25.description: A bit of kick to the roux- I decided on the seafood gumbo.. just a bit pricey in my opinion, but I don't mind paying for decent to excellent food. The staff were genuine and nice. I'll be back to try other menu items

12.description: First time trying this establishment and I must say I was completely disappointed . I tried the gumbo wings and the texture was very slimy considering the fact that they just came out the deep fryer . Thanks but no thanks

21.description: True confession: I haven't been to this restaurant. But I was at the Hyde Park jazz festival, they had a booth, and I thought I'd take a chance on the seafood gumbo. It wasn't cheap; if I remember correctly, I gave up a mug of Alexander Hamilton for the pleasure.But DAMN, that was GOOD gumbo! Perfect amount of spice--will perk you just up a little, while letting you concentrate on the flavor rather than the heat. Tasty morsels of seafood and andouille. (I checked it out for my pescatarian friend, though she was willing to suspend disbelief of the presence of sausage long enough to try a shrimp and bless the delicious roux.) This place is pretty deep in the south, which I guess is appropriate for a creole place. I will definitely venture down there for lunch sometime, and perhaps stop by Calumet Fisheries on the way back for some of their smokey goodness for dinner.

16.description: There is nothing bad to say about Anita's. Everything I've tried here is DELISH but my absolute favorite are the blazin gumbo wings! The peach cobbler is THE BEST I've had anywhere, ever. After my first visit I went back 2 more times within that same week! If I didn't know better i'd swear they put crack in the food- it's sooooo good and addicting...

17.description: Probably the best place you can grab food quick in South Shore.

10.description: I love this place. I have a seafood allergy but that doesn't mean I can't enjoy delicious gumbo. My first dish here was the Caribbean and I've been hooked since. Doesn't help that it's literally right around the corner-less than a 2 minute walk. The desserts are wonderful, the mac n cheese is great, and the wings are perfection. Check out Anita's Big Chase-it's $27.99 for shrimp gumbolaya, chicken gumbolaya, 2 liter pop, 6 gumbo wings and 6 buttermilk wings. I can feed my family of 5 with leftovers.

11.description: I actually first learned about Anita's from the huge billboard on the Dan Ryan. After that all that publicity it was actually not the easiest to find. The signage isn't highly visible. It's on a corner of a tightly packed strip mall. On to the gumbo.. It was salty and overall just okay. My major issue was with the process at Anita's.-First the staff was not very accommodating: I requested to have rice and gumbo separated because I was counting carbs. I was told that this is not an option with the lunch special and they try to avoid customizations. The cashier. then added that they used to serve separately but customers reported that this was too cumbersome. Hmmm, Okay while I can appreciate that... This customer is requesting rice on the side. Oh well says Anita's, no can do, you have to order the 1/2. This essentially means no lunch special for me because I want rice &gumbo separate ... This is clearly because they want to give you a smaller portion and fill the container with mostly rice. Thats understandable because lunch options are generally smaller, so putting my rice and gumbo in 2 separate small containers seemed likes the obvious solution, but not to Anita's. SmhI won't be back because I wasn't wowed by the food and I was irritated with the service.Anita's gumbo, please check out MSNBC's The Profit, you could learn a lot about improving your process and satisfying customers.

26.description: I just left anita's gumbo I ordered the  buttermilk  wings which came with gumbo. The wings were overcooked and had no seasoning at all! The gumbo was spicy but had no flavor , spice  does not equal flavor . I went , I saw I will not return!

27.description: Im sorry....i just finished eating  Saturday's leftover seafood gumbo ,which prompted me to write ANOTHER review .....Wtf! Anita, Where have you been all my life?????    Lol ok im done!THEE .....BEST......FOOD.....EVER! Nuff said

0.description: Of all nights to try this joint I picked FAT TUESDAY.  The line was long but I didn't care, I had a craving for gumbo and nothing short of an all-out BLIZZARD and the cook quitting mid shift could stop me from acquiring a bowl that night.  So let's get to the good stuff . . . . the food and service.Note to Management:  Please have Streets and Sanitation or the owner of the Plaza in which you're located to put more lights on the building - it's hard to find you in the dark!!Like I said in my intro, when I arrived [or rather FINALLY found the place] the line was long but not bursting outside the door -  service was a little slow but I guess they had an after work surge AND the fact that it was Fat Tuesday.   Many people in the small [9x20] order/waiting area were new to the restaurant like me and just waiting for their food.  I found my place in line [humbly placed at #4] and scanned the menu.  I laid eyes on the coveted Gumbo which can be ordered as a half or full order.  Although the description states that the gumbo contains shrimp, crab, chicken, scallop, and sausage [which I assume is Turkey since they proudly state that their food does not contain BEEF OR PORK], your Gumbo will only contain scallops if you order the FULL size.  Also, the crab meat is served in a separate 2oz plastic sauce container for you to mix in at your pleasure - I thought this was nice.  Moving on, I figured since this was my first try, I would order a sample for me and my son to enjoy: Half order of Gumbo, Shrimp Gumblaya, 2 Gumbo Wings, and 2 Buttermilk Wings.  Oh and by the way Yelpers, the wing orders comes with a BONUS -  a side of Gumbo Rice w/ sausage  WOO-HOO!!!Verdict:  Guilty of getting the Itis.This place is THA BOMB!!!  Not many people know how to "do" a Roux right, and if you're a novice you will end up burning it but Ms Nita knows what she's doing [her and her sous chef].  I went to college in the South with friends from the Gulf Coast and tasted authentic homemade Gumbo from the Mobile, Alabama kitchen of my college BFF's Mother and Grandmother so I know what it should taste like.  The Gumbo was perfect, the Gumbalaya [name twist on Jambalaya] was equally as good, but the STAR of the order was the Gumbo Wings!!!  Sorry for my language Yelp but those wings were so damn good, I wanted to go back and propose marriage to whoever battered, fried, and sauced those wings!!!  A flavor that can only be explained as taking a good but not overly seasoned wing and dipping it in a flavorful Gumbo/Roux gravy.All in all, I will definitely be returning to patronize Nita's Gumbo and you should too.

20.description: I stopped in Anita's Gumbo this evening after salivating thinking about delicious gumbo! I'm so glad I was determined to stop in because it was absolutely AMAZING! I ordered the Signature Gumbo and buttermilk wings! The Gumbo: nice kick of spice!  Delicious roux! Nice amount of crab, shrimp, chicken and sausage! The wings: Delish! I didn't get the wings with the roux on top since I figured it was pretty much the gumbo I had on the side. The customer service was excellent! Everyone was friendly, the owner was very personable as well! Thank you for bringing delicious Gumbo to Chicago! I'll be spreading the word and will also return!

19.description: Great food, It will fill you up!

2.description: Tried for the first time this evening. Really good. However it was much too spicy for me. Line I'll go back and ask if they can adjust the spice

18.description: Absolutely loved my shrimp po' boy! OK so I may be a bit biased because its so close to my house and I just want you to stay forever Anita's Gumbo. Its great having another flavorful option.I thought the price was pretty reasonable and the food was good. My only suggestion would be to create a kids meal the chicken was good but the gumbo on the side was a bit spicy for my 3 year old.

13.description: Finally lucked out and had the opportunity to try Anita's Gumbo.I had them bookmarked for a while.Tried their chicken and also their seafood gumbo.Both were delicious.The only thing I wasn't too crazy about is that they're TAKE OUT ONLY.Bummer.But as far as the food and service is concerned,WORTH STOPPING IN!!!! The young man at the counter noticed that I waited a bit probably longer than usual(no more than 20 minutes) and gave me some FREE BUTTER COOKIES!!!! That was really nice and appreciated.Good experience overall and portions were HUGE!!

4.description: I am giving this review based on their flip flop policies.  I've been ordering Gumbo hear for the last year.  I always order the signature gumbo and my rice is on the side,except when I order the lunch special which I am told always has the rice in the bowl.  Now on Friday, I order the 1/2 order gumbo. I get my order and am told the rice is mixed in already.  I don't like rice, and am cutting carbs. So I'm pissed off, I have never gotten it with rice in the bowl. In fact the cashier has always stated, "Lunch specials are the only gumbos that have the rice already in it". if I didn't want the rice in the bowl I have to order the Gumbo off the regular priced menu. So, imagine my surprise.  I was told since they increased the price this is also the new policies.  This fact should have been posted.  Anita's Gumbo has raised their Gumbo price by 20%, and you would think that would be enough to offset the overhead etc.   I don't pay for rice!!  Mind you I get home, and of course I have a bowl of rice with Gumbo roux............your practices are a little bi-polar Anita's Gumbo.  Be consistent for a while.  Gumbo is good. But to use rice as a filler and do a price increase is just completely unfair.

24.description: So far everything I've had from here is delisious. the Carribean Gumbo, the buttermilk wings, the gumbo wings, the shrimp and chicken gumbolaya, the sweet potatoe pie, the gumbo rice, all of it! The lunch specials are a great deal and a great option to try some higher priced menu options or only $6.50. Went last night and got one of the deals for $27.99 and was able to feed a family of 5 (4 adults and 1 child), and had leftovers!!!! Great flavor, fresh made to order food, beautiful design! Worth a trip to the southside!!!!

6.description: Outside of Hyde Park, there are few choices outside of mediocre tacos, fried foods, jerk and fast food so it's great that there's a gumbo spot on the south side.  If you're looking for whole crab legs in your gumbo - this is not the spot. But The ingredients are fresh and seasoned well, it is very tasty, and more importantly the shrimp they use does not shrivel up , and is not over cooked when fried and it is very juicy. And the different types of gumbo actually taste different so you're getting a different experience. I like it.

22.description: Finally lucked out and had the opportunity to try Anita's Gumbo.I had them bookmarked for a while.Tried their chicken and also their seafood gumbo.Both were delicious.The only thing I wasn't too crazy about is that they're TAKE OUT ONLY.Bummer.But as far as the food and service is concerned,WORTH STOPPING IN!!!! The young man at the counter noticed that I waited a bit probably longer than usual(no more than 20 minutes) and gave me some FREE BUTTER COOKIES!!!! That was really nice and appreciated.Good experience overall and portions were HUGE!!

15.description: They just opened on May 31st, 2014. Probably working out some kinks at the restaurant. So far I received carry-out for the Wednesday special Caribbean Gumbo. The roux is pretty good and it's not very spicy. Alittle lacking in the amount of meat and mostly rice, but i'll see what happens later.All menu items are made to order so anticipate waiting 10-20mins for your take-out food. Signs are posted.At the time of writing this review, their temporary hours of operation are:Sunday: ClosedMonday: ClosedTuesday: 11am-6pmWednesday: 11am-6pmThursday: 11am-6pmFriday: 11am-7pmSaturday: 11am-7pm

7.description: The gumbo roux was great!! I'm a big seafood eater so I would have liked more crab meat but over all the gumbo and Wednesday special was great!!

8.description: True confession: I haven't been to this restaurant. But I was at the Hyde Park jazz festival, they had a booth, and I thought I'd take a chance on the seafood gumbo. It wasn't cheap; if I remember correctly, I gave up a mug of Alexander Hamilton for the pleasure.But DAMN, that was GOOD gumbo! Perfect amount of spice--will perk you just up a little, while letting you concentrate on the flavor rather than the heat. Tasty morsels of seafood and andouille. (I checked it out for my pescatarian friend, though she was willing to suspend disbelief of the presence of sausage long enough to try a shrimp and bless the delicious roux.) This place is pretty deep in the south, which I guess is appropriate for a creole place. I will definitely venture down there for lunch sometime, and perhaps stop by Calumet Fisheries on the way back for some of their smokey goodness for dinner.

30.description: Had potential but a little pricey for gumbo. Ordered a lunch special and thought the portion sizes were a little small. Got nickeled and dimed on a can soda when there was no distinction on the menu about excluded items. I will give it one more try but felt that it has a long way to go.

3.description: Heard about Anita's from my friend and since she was in my neighborhood, I gave her a try and I am sooo glad I did. Her signature gumbo is authentic, hearty, and delicious! My hubby had the gumbolaya and my friend had a tangy shrimp po boy, which was all delicous. Her service was courteous and they had my food was ready when they said it would be time. Anita has a repeat customer!

14.description: AMAZING!! the gumbo was soooo good and flavorful! the roux was just the right texture & taste & the customer service was on point. the only thing I didn't like what that I had to crack open the crab legs & made a mess. I wish they had an option with them crab leg meat instead of the whole leg but that was honestly minor. I will DEF. be back!

1.description: I had the worst experience with a piercer on the south side.  I came to Jay at Inkhart Tattoos and he hooked me up.  He told me how to care for my new nose stud and he was very professional and provided great customer service.  The other employees that I came in contact with were just as awesome with their customer service.  I will be back when I'm ready to cover up this stupid Mickey Mouse tat I got when I was a teenager.  I highly recommend this place!

2.description: DOPE AS HELL, actual artist and not super expensive, you can see your tat on there facebook too!

0.description: I went to Inkhart for my first tattoo. Reggie was strongly recommended by a good friend and I was impressed with his work. I sent him several pics with the concept of what I wanted and what he designed was better than I expected. Additionally, he gave very useful guidance on what script we should use, the placement of the text and use of color. Reggie also did my son's first tattoo and he was very happy. We'll be back.

3.description: A hidden gem! From two towns over and was looking for a new meat market. Read the reviews on here and decided to try it. Great knowledgeable butcher with a great selection. Just tried the Wisconsin brats for lunch, very tasty! Looking forward to the others meats we picked up. Prices are very competitive with the big box store. Love going to mom and pop places. Worth the drive if you live a few towns over.

1.description: This place is as good as it gets. The butchers go out of their way to make sure you get exactlly what you want. They are very friendly and ougoing. The store has all those last minute items you may have forgotten to get earlier. The meat is fresh and well displayed so you can see what you are buying.

2.description: A blast from the past neighborhood grocery store.  They have the staples and the best part is the Meat Counter!!  The best meat you'll find around.  The potato sausage is incredible.  They even take the membrane off of the ribs when you order them, Jewel's butchers wont.  Well worth the effort to find this gem in the off beaten path.

9.description: A classic, superb "Mom & Pop's" grocery store.  The kind of small business that we all need to support.  The meat counter is superb, with great product and butchering.  Their ground beef is so far better than the local megamart crap.  Yeah, you will spend a couple dollars more for the items off the shelf, but you'll feel better making purchases from a small business that has nice people in it.

10.description: Mom and pop very tiny, old fashioned grocer. Very friendly staff. What people come for is the meat counter. The best fresh cut meat around.

4.description: We are pleased to have found this little gem.  We usually do a lot of our shopping at a big name grocer but I am looking for that small and local relationship not too far from home so this fit the bill.  When we first pulled into the parking lot I was a little skeptical, since we are not familiar with the neighbor hood and live in a cookie cutter subdivision just west of Mitchell's. We walked in and checked out the meat department and I was instantly sold. We placed an order for some rib tips that were not available and ordered some meat and cheeses. When the day came to pick our order up, I was able to call and confirm that the order was there and all this was done with professionalism, and you can tell their customers happiness is important to them.  We will be back and excited to get to know those behind the meat counter at Mitchell's.

6.description: Been going there all my life including my grandmother, mother, aunts, and cousins. Never had a piece of bad meat. Its nice to have a neighborhood store like this.

12.description: Meat. Meat. Meat. Chicken. Chicken. Chicken. No hidden fat like from chains. Everything perfectly and honestly trimmed. Ground chuck. No gristle. And tasty.

5.description: Great little place right down the rode from me. Love getting meat where your supposed to. A MEAT market!

13.description: Yes!! Mitchell's is by far the best place to get your fresh deli and meats. We moved out here 40 years ago and been shopping at Mitchell's ever since!

11.description: Its great to see a small old-fashioned grocery stand on its own among the sea of superstores out there overwhelming our neighborhoods.  Sure seems like nothing here has changed a bit from when I started patronizing this establishment some 15 years ago.  I believe they're more well known for their meat and deli section.  Such high quality at a great price (their hot Italian sausages are my favorite).  Next time you're in the area and get a hankering for some groceries, skip the chains and give this place a visit.

8.description: This small neighborhood grocery has the BEST fresh meat you will ever buy!

0.description: When I moved from New Lenox I was in need of a new meat market. My husband's family had been using Mitchell's for years.  This is now the only place I go. Their cuts of meat are fantastic. The employees are so helpful and kind. It's important to keep these small business owners in business. I suggest you give them a try.

7.description: My family used to own a grocery store that was built around customer service and our meat dept. Their meat dept. is outstanding. The best place to get meat. Tony's on rte. 59 in Plainfield is the only other place that I get ribs and steaks. I will always go to here first though.

0.description: When my loctition ditched out on me Tameca agreed to take me last minute, the night before her birthday. Excellent customer service, some great loc advice, and quality service. I left out extremely happy with my retwist!
